name: Sean
text:
Dr. Al has accomplished what all my former shrinks failed to do.  We have a working cocktail/routine.  Some of my former doctors seemed to just be going through the motions; Ok we'll swap out X for Y and wait a month then increase Y and wait...
It makes a difference when your doctor is sincere and wants to get you to a good place.  He has also assembled a very friendly and efficient staff.

name: Christopher Shrout
text: Dr. Watts is great and the practice has been easy to deal with! No complaints from my end at all. They usually answer my voicemails within a couple hours.

name: Ray Uzun
text: Not a patient anymore as of 5 min ago. They tried to charge me $125 because they didn't put in my insurance information.  They almost never answer the phone or call back and the Receptionist just canceled my appointment instead of talking to billing like they said they would. I liked dr lauepple but the staff is ridiculously incompetent or lazy. Not sure which. Turn out my primary doctor can do the same thing without the extra drama.

name: Katt
text: I went to this hospital as an adolescent and when I tell you this place is a place in nightmares, I truly mean that. The staff was so incredibly rude and as were the doctors, they didn’t care about us, just the money. It was so disgusting, roaches, rats, mice, etc. The second and last time I was sent to Hillcrest they threatened to keep me until I was 18 and I was 14 at the time, I was dealing with depression, eating disorders, and suicidal thoughts and tendencies. Anytime I got the chance to talk to my parents I begged and pleaded and cried to them to please get me out of there. That place was so traumatizing and not somewhere someone dealing with mental illness should be sent. I’m 23 now and the experience I had there still haunts me. I can’t believe this place is still open with all the negative reviews.

name: Sara Irelan
text: This is the worst place you can go if you need help. Please trust me. The staff are extremely rude and do not care about you. All they want is money. If anything it will just make you worse. The place is absolutely disgusting also. Never send anyone here and if they're already there and they're saying they need to leave please believe them. They will be really nice to the parent that calls and then make you feel bad at yell at you for calling saying you need to leave. I can say that because I have personally experienced that. If I could I would give this place a zero star rating.

resp.text: Hi, Sara. Thank you for taking the time to reach out to us. We take your feedback very seriously and would like to address your concerns. So that we can better assist you, please provide us with your full name by visiting http://www.hillcrestbhs.com/contact-us/. Again, thank you. We hope to hear from you soon.

name: karen murphy
text: I do not have enough adjectives to describe the professional and supportive staff. During a time of crisis it is so important to be able to lean on and trust the judgment of a caregiving team. Highly recommend.

resp.text: Hi, Karen. Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us! Kind words such as these are held very dear to our hearts, so we will be sure to pass your comments along.  We hope you are doing well, and thank you again!

name: el uhhh
text: this place is genuinely awful. it’s dirty, the staff is terribly disrespectful to the patients, and the facility is just overall extremely poor quality. please do NOT send your child here. it is very clear that 90% of the staff do not have an ounce of care in them for the patients & they only care about the money. i would not recommend this place to a single person. i was genuinely in shock at the amount of disrespect i witnessed during my stay. the fact that the staff is actively treating patients (who ALREADY struggle with mental illness) so poorly is disgusting. a child needs love and care to heal properly, and this place provides neither.

resp.text: Hi. Thank you for sharing your concerns with us. We'd appreciate the opportunity to discuss them with you in more detail directly. Should you wish to speak with a representative in more detail, please provide us with your contact information by visiting http://www.hillcrestbhs.com/contact-us/. Thank you again.

name: Jadie Babe_20
text: The lady at the front desk is literally the rudest woman/staff member! Acted as though it was a big deal to ask any type of questions and acted like it was an act of Congress to even answer questions that were asked about a patients well being. They could care less about being helpful or even giving a school excuse for said child/children. Wouldn’t send anyone to this place. All they care about is getting paid and going home.

resp.text: Hi. Thank you for reaching out to us with your feedback. So that we can address your concerns directly, please provide us with your contact information by visiting http://www.hillcrestbhs.com/contact-us/. Thank you again.

name: Joshualilswag
text: Hillcrest is an amazing place the staff are nice and friendly they really care about the kids when I was there one of the staff member  bought his PlayStation we all took turn it was a lot of fun I came to hillcrest in December and left January I was only there for for like 22 I had so much fun the food was amazing the staff memeber really care for you more than your own parent I had so much fun at hillcrest there was a basketball ball gym a game room every time you go for breakfast or lunch you have a lot of option and at the end of the day they even give you snack hillcrest was a fun experience for hillcrest made a better they help me with my problem hillcrest was a beautiful place you just have to experience for yourself it such a fun place at first when I came to hillcrest I wasn’t happy but then I really started enjoying the place I highly recommend they will really take good care of you and help you with what you going through

resp.text: Hi. It means the world to us that you took time out of your day to leave us this great feedback. Thank you, and we hope you have a pleasant day.

name: Brittany Warren
text:
Worst place ever...Staff assaults children especially Mr Greg.  Staff is very rude.threatened me with dhr.Even told my 14 year old if I discharged him ama insurance would not pay his medical bill. Not only is this misinformation it is not information you burden a 14 year old with
i discharged  him without concern of any of these threats.Never send your  child to this place...

name: Christian Campbell
text: DO NOT SEND ANYONE HERE!!!!!!The place should have 0 stars the people there are ugly, rude, and do not care one bit about anyone in there. I finally was able to talk to my loved one and she said that she was scared to death crying to me how they were mean and didn't care what so ever about anyone! This place should be shut down because no one I mean no one should have to go through that when they are there for help not for getting mental and emotional abused! Help us shut this place down!

resp.text: Hi, Christian. Thank you for taking the time to reach out to us with your concerns. We take your comments very seriously and would like to learn more about your loved one’s concerns. Due to federal patient privacy laws, we can only discuss care with a patient or guardian; however, we encourage your loved one to reach out to us directly by visiting http://www.hillcrestbhs.com/contact-us/. Again, thank you.

name: Jack Simmons
text: The staff is extremely rude, there are maggots in the showers, roaches everywhere. The food is horrible, looks like pig slop. They treat the patients like outcasts and they don't even help them.

resp.text: Hi, Jack. Thank you for taking the time to reach out to us. We take your feedback very seriously and would like to learn more so that we can address your concerns. If you wish to speak with a representative in more detail, please provide us with your contact information by visiting http://www.hillcrestbhs.com/contact-us/. Again, thank you for bringing your concerns to our attention. We hope to hear from you soon.

name: Sarah Ramjit
text: So I've been waiting for days for someone to contact me about my question and still nothing I've filled out the question and concerns form on the website then when I was finished it said someone will contact me shortly and I have been waiting for days now when will someone contact me??

resp.text: Hi, Sarah. Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. So that we can follow up with you directly, please provide us with your contact information by visiting http://www.hillcrestbhs.com/contact-us/. Thank you again.

name: gtfo
text: Took me years to even find this place, yet here we are. My memory is fuzzy but I can confirm most of the other stories here. Overuse of what is essentially tranquilizers on young children for any reason they feel like, withholding food, really poor quality food as well, screaming and yelling abuse from nurses. Being locked in rooms all night with no way out until morning. Little to no enrichment of any kind. We were allowed outside once a week if that and under such tight supervision we could barely walk two feet without being screamed at. I recall that the dozen or more kids in my unit were all forced to share one pack of playing cards and were not provided anything else. We had to plead for paper and crayons and even then those were often confiscated. Clothes, valuables, personal items were stolen. Contact with parents, even over the phone, was extremely minimal. I could go on, but my point is: DO NOT EVER, FOR ANY REASON, SEND YOUR CHILD HERE. It is a nightmare on earth.

resp.text: Hello Parker, thank you for taking the time to share a review. When you have a chance, please reach out to us at http://www.hillcrestbhs.com/contact-us/ so we can discuss this matter further.

name: Julie Sousa
text: I have not even been able to get in to this place after being referred 8 days ago and staff is so rude and I asked for it vice and they let me know they are not allowed to give advice. They act like they don't have the time to beyond the phone answering anyone's questions and God forbid if you dare ask them to do something. I don't know what hours then Keane by trying to see a doctor here and especially no way would I take my child with and a place with no empathy no sympathy and the rudest employees I've ever met actually only spoke with crystal

name: Kimberly Reed
text: I had to give one star to write review otherwise I wouldnt have given you 1. This facility has had positive cases of COVID 19 and for some reason I can't seem to find where it has been reported to the health department. This is not opinion about positive cases this is fact. They did not tell parents that they had suspicions or that they tested everybody(not even the when the child was discharged) and when called and asked about it, was transfered to someone else and then someone else and never given an answer and as a result those people that left this facility potentially passed this virus to who knows how many others .. And how do I know this because this is my experience. My child has been out of this facility for 3 days now and I called because she told me she was tested and there were positive cases and I got the run around and even had some staff outright they were unaware of any cases and today the test results came in and you had no choice but to notify people. And yet I still do not see where the health department has been notified.

resp.text: Hi, Kimberly. Please know that the safety and health of our patients and staff is our number one priority. We are working hard to prevent the spread of the disease and to ensure we are prepared to treat patients who test positive due to community exposure. This includes screening of all patients prior to entry into our facility and establishment of clear treatment protocols. We are following all guidelines from the CDC – including appropriate use of masks – and are engaged with local county and government officials on a daily basis. Thank you.

name: Grace Roberson
text: This place was horrible I was here twice. Once in 2014 and once in 2017 first time I was on adlescent and second time I was on rise a residential unit. They dont care about you and they cant stop the fights. DO NOT GO THERE.

resp.text: Hi, Grace. Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. So that we can follow up with you directly, please provide us with your contact information by visiting http://www.hillcrestbhs.com/contact-us/. Thank you again.

name: Christine Roof
text: I think they really helped my son .

name: Kenyana Dupree
text: I was admitted here a little over 20 years ago and at first I was angry and actually broke out, but by the time I was discharged my family relationships got better. I felt better emotionally. They helped me get free from the chains holding me down. I am thankful to have been there. This place saved me. My psychiatrist Tom, I believe that was his name, was excellent. Im not sure about the condition of the facility now, but back then it was very clean and things were not as these reviews have stated. I was out of control and they gave me a way to express myself without exploding. I love this place for what they did for me. And my school work stayed on honor roll. Your parents should have made sure of that. My mother made sure i had school books and assignments. Don't fault the staff for things your parents should have been on top of. The parents have to stay involved in the treatment plan. You cant just drop children off and forget them. Its treatment center to help, not to take over the duties of the parents.

name: Aha Broun
text: TERRIBLE STAFF, DOCTORS, PSYCHIATRIC TEAM. Was sent here for suicide attempts and because of the nature of the facility, a behavioral one, I was treated as if I had an issue with acting out. The facility was in poor condition and felt like a prison. It was cold and dark, the physical aspects and the emotional aspects. I've never wanted to kill myself more than I did being in there. The group setting meant I had to engage all day long with girls that were up to 10 years younger than me, on topics that would fit across the spectrum but really weren't what I was dealing with. It was about being nice and sitting still, being a good boy or girl because you were told to. There was absolutely no mental health aspects that would help me in the facility. I mostly colored and waited to go home. Terrible terrible place, nightmare of my life. Do not send your loved ones to this facility.

name: Anaya Darrah
text: I stay at this disgusting facility for a month. It was the worst month of my life. The staff are very rude and abusive. The staff cuss patients out and get attitudes with the patients. I came out of that hospital 2 times worse than when I came. I never want to go near that building again. I wish I could give it 0 stars but I can’t. The patients are out of control and there’s a fight every 30 seconds. I just wanted to leave the whole time. They put stuff in the food to make you fatter. And the medicine they put me on made my mental illnesses worse. PLEASE DONT SEND PEOPLE HERE

resp.text: We would like the opportunity to address your concerns. Please reach out to us at http://www.hillcrestbhs.com/contact-us/ when you have a chance. Thank you, and we look forward to hearing from you.

name: Kaley O'Neal
text: This is the absolute worst place. I have never been mistreated so much in my life. There were 2 women here that really helped me.. Ms. Theresa and Ms. Brandi. That’s the only good thing I experienced. The food was so gross, I ate dry cereal every day. I post 15 pounds when I was there.. It’s like jail, well 10 mines worse. You are locked up and you can barely go outside. The lunch lady called me a b**** once. It was just overall hell on earth and I would NEVER send any of my children here. It’s gave me PTSD that I will have to live with for the rest of my life.

name: Pamela French
text: Well after seeing the reviews I was nervous. I came in on time. Signed in, my appointment was at 2:30. After sitting until 4pm they called my name about a co-pay. My wallet wasn't in my purse so I asked the front if my mom can bring the $3.90. She said you won't be able to be seen if it takes too long. It took my mom 15 minutes to get there. I see the nurse laughing LOOKING AT ME. BASICALLY TELLS HER RESCHEDULE. MAYBE IF IT DIDN'T TAKE AN HOUR TO SAY YOU HAVE A CO-PAY BECAUSE BEING ON MEDICAID DISABILITY I BARELY HAVE CO-PAYMENTS. BUT TO SIT THERE THAT LONG AND BE TOLD WELL YOU CAN'T BE SEEN BECAUSE OF $3.90. AND THE NURSE LOOKS AT ME LAUGHING WHILE TALKING ABOUT ME. SCREW YOU

name: A'Mya Julius
text: They letting the kids touch each other and not doing anything about it I have someone up here and it’s not going good at all never can get through or speak to the proper person

name: Rhonda Jennings
text: My step son was there, and he was in a special program. After a couple of months the program lost funding. They still kept him there getting that money, but he wasn't getting any help!!  He was there by court order, and he seriously needed help. All he had to do was play video games at this place, and hang out. They did nothing to council him, or help him.

resp.text: Hello Rhonda, we would like the opportunity to address this. Please reach out to us at http://www.hillcrestbhs.com/contact-us/.

name: Kendall White
text: Most disgusting horrible place ew !!!! Wish I could give 0 stars worst staff

resp.text: Hi, Kendall. We take your feedback very seriously and would like to learn more about your concerns. So that we can follow up with you directly, please provide us with your contact information by visiting http://www.hillcrestbhs.com/contact-us/. Thank you again.

name: Quinderrica Davis
text: Hill Crest the Worst place to even get help the Staff Very Rude They hit on Us They Put Stuff inside the food to make us bigger  they dont care about us They get there money and go home

name: Kameron Boswell
text: I went to Hill Crest back in December of 2014. The building itself is disgusting. Staff treats the patients that might require special needs like they are nothing. It's not fair to the patients. Especially the adolescents who did/do not have a choice if they are there or not. I do remember the staff that helped with our adolescent group was usually nice. Except for Mr. Damiyan and a nurse who and I quote said "hey you in the red jacket turn around and shut up!". There was also a fight at the facility in the cafeteria. Do I think that Hill Crest is a horrible place to be? Yes! I agree 100%

name: Joe Noe
text: The black lady at the desk and one of the staff which was black too looked right through me as if I weren't fit to be on the same planet as them. And then instead of explaining to me that I needed a number to collect items from a patient she rudely looked at me condescendingly and asked is there anything else instead of just explaining that to me first. And there was absolutely no cordial greeting or dismissal at all no manners what so ever indicative of the area so I was not surprised at all that behavior towards whites is condoned and wide spread in the Birmingham area.

name: Terence Darden
text: Don’t believe all the negative reviews about this place. The people there treated me well in my 30 day recovery. Very professional and committed to helping others who want help for themselves.

name: Aliza Robinson
text: I've been to multiple mental hospitals but this one was BY FAR the worst. The staff was rude and wouldn't let me use the bathroom, there were fights and screaming all the time, they gave kids shots to make them sleep against their will, wouldn't give me my birth control, and when I left they didn't return all of my stuff to me!! Worst place ever don't EVER send your kids here.

resp.text: Hi, ­­­­thank you for taking the time to reach out to us. We take patient feedback very seriously and would like to address your concerns. So that we can better assist you, please provide us with your full name and location in our facility by visiting http://www.hillcrestbhs.com/contact-us/. Again, thank you. We hope to hear from you soon.

name: LaurA Heaps
text: I was in this hospital back in the early 80s and found that I received help I really needed. Especially by psychologist Michael Holt

resp.text: Hi, Laura. We are so glad to hear about your experience! Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We hope you are doing well. Take care!

name: Don't panic JustLive
text: I went there when I was in the 3rd grade , I am now 17, but I was admitted there for 9 days, and even to this day I remember the traumatic experiences there. I had to go there because a doctor who I saw put me on a very strong medication for anxiety and I had severe side effects and had to get off of it. I remember the staff there looked at me and told me the day before I was going home that every kid comes back at least 2 times, and that I'd be back in no time. My mom was told lies by the staff, I was mistreated, yelled at, and even punished for throwing up in the floor by accident. I was in the 3rd grade and the reason I threw up was because I was so stressed and traumatized by the things that were happening it literally drove me to become sick!! One day when I was supposed to get a visit with my mom, my mom drove and was waiting to see me and they told me I couldn't see her that she didn't come , and told her that I had done something and my privileges of a visit were revoked. I was crying in my sleep every single night and the staff claimed they came in my room and calmed me down , they told my mom that, but they never did that, they did the complete opposite, they'd open the door and told me to hush up and would slam it behind them. I remember the first day I was told my one of the staff members that you could put your shoe in the door when you were in your room so it wasn't shut all the way if you didn't like having the door shut, and every kid had done the same thing, well I heard one of the staff members telling a man that "we got a new one" he came in there poked his head in the door and yelled "your door has to be shut" and slammed it, and then walked off laughing. I barely remember what he looked like but he was tall as I remember, had a beard and I'm pretty sure had reddish hair. That place was horrible and no parent should ever take their kid there, my mother didn't know any of that would've happened and she said if she knew she would've have never taken me there. She was in shock and extremely upset after she found out everything that had happened. I was a little kid, only in the 3rd grade. Now I am 17, soon to be graduating and I'm becoming a police officer. My life is looking way up, and maybe when I become an officer I can get people like those who worked there , that abuse and mistreat PATIENTS like that, away from children. People like that do NOT need to work with children. This place does NOT help people, it messes them up even worse. I would not even take my dog there. The people who work there with people who are admitted should be ashamed of themselves and how they treat kids and patients. I've read all of these reviews and there's not even one good one here. People who treat kids that way should never be allowed around a child. EVER. That place needs to close down.

name: jane cantrell
text: I was there about 25 years ago. Some staff were great ,some not so much.Bigest thing I didn,t like being locked up.But they helped me in a rough patch long ago in my life.

name: Misty Pitts (Misty Michelle)
text: I see Dr Shakil Khan. Yes, there are times when he has to stop seeing appointments and take care of patients that are in the hospital side. He always apologizes for the delay. I've been a patient of his for 6yrs and he's discussed my condition and treatment options. He's very respectful to me, but he doesn't let anyone disrespect him or walk all over him either. I would definitely recommend him to anyone who has a similar condition.

name: John Rittmann
text: Hillcrest Behavioral Health has always been compassionate and attentive. The staff on the RISE unit is flexible to client needs. Mr. Johnson goes above and beyond when helping other professionals. The therapeutic staff provides insightful, helpful services.

name: Krissy Cinnamon
text: I would leave a ZERO if possible. This is a horrible place for children seeking to be in a better place in life. I have mentored a young lady for over 2 years. They keep changing the password, refuse to call me back on her passes after numerous calls and voicemails. I pick her up almost every weekend. They say I’ve never been there before. I have been out of town for work for two weeks, but picked her up every weekend EXCEPT for a work conference. I requested off work to get her today. They write passes when I’m at work and refuse to write them when I request off for work. Today I was talked to like trash and not even allowed to speak with her. I call during the week and I’m not even asked for a password. This makes no sense and my heart goes out to any child that is left in the care of such heartless workers. *Came back to leave a 2nd review about another bad experience, but it has to go under the first review. I showed up to pick up the SAME child I was awarded custody of finally. I called an hour in advance to make sure she was ready. I was told she was. I waited almost 3 hours checking in on and off trying to figure out what was taking so long.  I was finally told by the secretary that they FORGOT I was waiting (for 3 hours). Now this child is still there because they FORGOT I was there for 3 hours. Called me when I got home an hour and a half later (total of 5 hours) to say she was ready.....PLEASE GET YOUR CHILD SAFELY OUT OF THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS. I am heartbroken for this young lady in the hands of people that can FORGET she has a home after around 12 plus years of not having one. This is a shame. AND they will NOT admit to their wrongdoings. They simply said they brought her downstairs...but forgot the total of 5 hours drive time/wait time in which I missed work to pick this young lady up. This is SAD and they need to be investigated.

name: stephanie martinez
text: Hillcrest Hospital has qualified social workers, counselors, psychologists, and psychiatrists to meet the behavioral, emotional, and psychiatric needs of children and adolescents. They really helped my child in her time of need. I was scared to have my child admitted to the inpatient psychiatry unit at first but I am so happy I did no listen to the negative reviews. Hillcrest Hospital really helped my child during this difficult time in her life.

name: Cherry
text: Deserves 0 stars. Worst experience I’ve had in my life no kidding. I’d rather go to prison for a year then stay 6 months in this place. I was on the adolescent unit for 10 days. I saw the worst of the worst. A kid that just got there said “I want to go home” and what they did was get 3 men to hold this kid down and a nurse come over and give him 2 shots in the butt right in front of everyone. And that happened at least 3 more times. Then I got a switched to another room and while I was there laying on my bed at rest period my room mate told one of the techs that I said a girl had a nice butt and that she was “fine” which never even happened and I got in trouble for it. And one day there was this really small and skinny kid he was like 13 or 14 he said something along the lines of “I want to go home this place sucks” and they asked him what he said and then he said it again and then they got 2 220lbs+ guys and a nurse to restrain him by sitting on him and giving him a shot that really messed him up he couldn’t walk and barely could talk and was drooling everywhere and the tech asked him to get up and he barely even responded and so what they did was push down his arms on the edge of a rubber sofa type thing and and one of guys pushes his arm down with so much force it snapped this kids arm with *pop* sound and they didn’t take this kid to the hospital till the next day. Another thing that happened was I had a major panic attack and all the staff did was sit and laugh at me. Another thing that happened was a kid just started punching another kid randomly in the face when he didn’t even do anything and they gave both of them shots when the one guy did absolutely nothing at all. And one of the girls a day later was just sitting in the hall scratching her arm till it was bleeding everywhere and all they did was say “quit” and walked off even tho she kept doing it. And when my doctor prescribed me medicine they didn’t even taper down which mad my jaw lock up and I couldn’t talk for like 18 hours. But there was some things that were ok Dr. con was nice Mr. Scott was good and Mr rahshi I think his name was. The food was good to but ever since then I made a choice to never ever ask for help if there is a chance of me going here. Please don’t send anyone here. It’s abusive and the techs could care less about you.

name: suicide turtle
text: When I was there the staff was abusive (at least the men) everyone had a terrible attitude. When I received a call from my mother saying she was in the hospital I was sent back to the day room in tears talk about embarrassing it seems the staff (most of them) have no human emotions to other humans. Not to mention only seeing the doctor for a 2min breif convo every week (if your lucky)

name: Ben Richardson
text: Some time  ago    my  parents    bought  me  a  digital  watch   w/many  features.  I could  not  have  afforded   myself.  When  I  went  to  Hillcrest   I    was  told  I  couldn't  wear  the  watch  there,  It  would  go in  a  safe.  I  would  get it  back  when  I  left. Came  the day  to  leave. The  person  who  told  me all  this said  they  couldn't  find  my  watch. They  said  they were  sorry.  And  that's    all   they  said. They did  not  offer  to replace  the  watch or  give  me   the  cash  value so  I  could  replace  it  myself. The  beds  are    too  narrow   and  the  mattresses   are    extremely  uncomfortable.    So  if  they ask  to  hold  your  watch  say  no or  leave  it  at  home.

name: Brendan Turner
text: They do not care about their patients AT ALL. I have been written the wrong prescription twice by Dr. Munoz which has left me without the medication I need in order to function properly. Their staff shows zero concern whatsoever when I tell them that I need their help to get this medication I need for my own safety and stability. As of right now I have to wait over 11 days for my doctor to return from his vacation in order to get the correct prescription. I told them my health is at risk and they said, and I quote "my hands are tied, you will have to wait for your doctor to return from his vacation".

name: Malachi Mena
text: You want my opinion?! It is TERRIBLE. I'd give it 0 stars if I could, I cried my eyes out every day I went there, the food is alright.. But it was terrible for my mental health. I DO NOT RECOMMEND!!!!

resp.text: Malachi, thank you for your review. If you're willing to discuss this in more detail, please contact us at http://www.hillcrestbhs.com/contact-us/.

name: Nelly Sonia
text: Tbh I never wanna go back here...  I was so confused and I didn't get a reason for me being here but the staff are friendly but the food is 100 terrible the beds are so small,,,  bathrooms are squeezed up.. I'll miss the few friends I made here but I'm glad I'm out.. They wanted to give me medication which wasn't even signed for.. I couldn't see the time I couldn't do anything it's just terrible 100% why do they convince people on taking the medication yet we don't need it...  Some of the stuff are so mean and keep laughing at y'all like we crazy but we not...  Tbh I don't really think it's okay to put some of our loved ones here

name: jax cobain
text: Horrible smells like tuna fish casserole, needs to work on more positive outlooks for the kids who do what they are suppose to by giving them more resources, the food is cooked with burnt kittens and fish grease.

resp.text: Jax, we always appreciate the opportunity to improve, and we’d like to talk to you more about how we can do this. Please reach out to us at http://www.hillcrestbhs.com/contact-us/ when you have a moment, so we may discuss your review.

name: jerry price
text: My daughter has been in Hill Crest for four days due to Bipolar & ODD and so far we just found out she has been wearing the same cloths being her suitcase was found to be empty even though we just bought her new cloths the night we brought her. She was placed in restraints within the first 12 hours she was there when asked she said she was woke up being pushed into a wall and says she has a huge bruise on her face now.The ceilings have big mold spots in the bathrooms so no telling what they look like past the locked doors Plus when we first arrived we witnessed a staff member bring the wrong child to a parent to be discharged so YES this really is a horrible place and we plan to discharge our child immediately..Please for the sake of your kids DON'T take them here!!

name: matt fuller
text: This is by far the most unprofessional facility for mental wellness I have ever witnessed. My daughter was sent here for help, and it was only after that fact that we learned of the sickening behavior, and events that have taken place here. If you truly care for your child please do not send them there, and if they are there please for their own safety pick them up immediately. Numerous cases of abuse, sedation without reason, and many more stomach turning events. When we arrived the get our daughter the only thing that was mentioned to us was a bill we would receive... nothing on my daughters progress or anything. Your child would be safer at john wayne gacys house. That place should have been condemned long ago. Uhs is only in this for profit, not for unwell children who need help. Please, please, please do not leave your child there if you love them.

name: presley davis
text: I went here in September of 2014 for about 4 days. it did not help me whatsoever. they also lied to my parents about the schedule we would be on. while i was there my mom had a book that said things like at 2pm theyll be going to music class and things like that, but that wasnt true. they also told her there was a pool but thats not true either. a few of the staff were nice but most of them werent. my therapist when i was there was a white guy, dont remember his name, but he took me outside the facility to walk around a field and it was weird. dont take anyone here its falling apart and it sucks.

name: Brooklyn Hudson
text:
Resource: EXPERIENCE
I really feel this place should be closed down! I was on c-team. A sexual abuse unit in the hospital. Some of the staff were very helpful like Ms. Yulanda & Ms. Tameka. Other than that, the food is disgusting. They have hair in their food & very unsanitary. The food condiments were always sticky and stuck together or old looking. The restraints are just terrible. I was restrained maybe 3 times in the 8 months I was there, that’s just me though. I seen someone get restrained EVERY DAY. One of the girls I was close with actually got pushed down to the concrete and the staff had busted a blood socket in her left eye and left her bruised up! She had scrubs on and only panties. They had tore up her paper scrubs from dragging her on the concrete. I’m sorry but that is WAYYY over the line. They treat you like trash, and that incident has scarred me. Hillcrest changed me. Not for the better, but worst. They act like just because they give you outings and home passes that your stay will be great, but no. You lose your levels over stuff like dating people, sharing stuff, EVEN giving somebody something that they might need (hygiene products, shampoo, etc. ) in the facility, WE ARE TEENAGERS. We can’t help who we like!! This stay was terrible. I got put on precautions bc of how I felt! But truth be told, staff push you until you blow up then want to jump on you. I hate this place. And I’m sure I can speak for anyone. Thumbs down ALL the way. 😊

name: Clint Roberson
text: Doctor's never called me about my daughter. They were not giving my daughter her epilepsy medicine. They were negligent and horrible.

name: Ashley Garnett
text: Alabama is not a safe place to have children, it seems like they view them as just a means of income.by the way did they ever clean up that place in irondale? I know just a month ago I was watching a video titled the  Alabama corruption trial where the Alabama government was trying to conceal involvement in the dumping of hazardous waste in a black community there. Alabama sounds like such an awful place to be especially for children.

name: GraycieAnne Allen
text: These folks don't ever stick to the same rules when visiting, don't allow toddlers the things they need, even though children and toddlers should never have to go to this horrible place. The staff are rude and ignorant, they act like they all come from the hood, do they even have licenses to practice? We always dread even having to go here as the stress levels, and things you deal with just to visit are ludicrous.

name: Zoe Duncan
text:
Abusive staff, you sit in a room for 14 hours a day, no exercise, they make you easy excessive amounts of food, building is falling apart, therapists are abusive (especially Bernie Johnson) and the staff steals all of the valuables from the patients. It's also in the middle of a ghetto, you can hear gunshots and sirens at night and all of the nurses are idiots. The building is also falling apart and they refuse to do anything about it. It is in violation of several federal regulations concerning health and incarceration  (even though it's not a prison, although it's worse than one) and leaving someone in a jail cell will do them more good than this place will.

You know those horror stories about places like Penhurst Asylum and other mental hospitals in the early 1900s? This is the living embodiment of that.

name: Sheldon Sturgell
text: I was once resident here for over a year in rtc boys back when I was here it was still crazy but they had some figures there that I felt did help and they did try to help and those staff are mr Fred mr rob momma marry ans mr Clarence and mr Gary they truly saw passed a troubled child and tried to help me so to you guys I thank but other staff such as me Hubert and Chris and Darryl the loved to put there hand on me cause I was part white and Mexican and they like calling me racist names so one day after I seen mr Hubert beating up my little friend Chris slay I ran up punched and said a very mean thing back and then they all choose to attack me for sticking up for him and then they tried saying I was racist they broke my arm and did nothing it healed werid and that's why I was revised and they gave my grandma a check if they she wouldn't take them to court for a lot of cash but from what I see it's only gotten worse and the people that do care arnt there anymore or have no control over what happens cause the do like to threaten you with your job and all kinds of stuff so I would think about it before sending your family and love ones here and if some of the staff still work here see this I hope you get back what you did to all them kids and adults and to the people who did help me and other people thank you for your services you guys are great and I want to thank you for the time you guys gave me and truly took to help me and to the one who beat on me and everything else bet you won't na cause I'm 6'6 285 so mr rob better watch your ps and as cause I'm bigger you now boy frfr

name: Sharonda Marcum
text: I had to bring my suicidal son out here. They took advantage of that by not telling us it was not in our PPO insurance network when they knew that. We found out when we got the bill for EVERYTHING that went on while in there. I wouldn't reccomend this place to a dead rat!!!!!

name: Meghan Parson
text: My son was shot up with drugs he is highly allergic to affter several attempts myself as well as my child trying to tell him he was allergic to them it could kill him and assulted by a staff member on more than one occasion the staff told me he lied about it until i was on the phone today and it happened while we were speaking ...when i called back and tried to apeak with the person in charge of the person over the rtc boys unit the operator refused to give me the information when i pressed on about the subject i was given a random counselors name instead ...looks like the staff is clicked up like a school and look outfor the people in their group after aeveral attempts i still dont know who to contact about the verbal and physical abuse my son was subject to qhile on the phone with me im super worried about my son who did nothing to recieve the treatment he just got and im worried if they give him this drug for the third time after i and my son have warned them about this medication i dont know if thats the last time ill hear my sons voice or not since they refuse to let me speak to him to make sure hes ok now.....im devestated. And worried no mother should have to go through what im feeling right now

name: Abigail McCulloch
text: i was here for two weeks twice, let me tell you, this place is actually disgusting. the staff is homophobic and racist,(called me white trash and someone else the n word) (that was a white staff) the food is gross, the showers flood, there’s ants and roaches, and you can’t even see out of the windows. don’t send your child here.

name: The m and n show!! The m and n show!!
text: My son went here they kept him 2 and a half to 3 weeks upon checking him out they lost our 200.00 suit case and told us they would check storage but couldn't find it, then said they could give us a voucher but not for the full amount of the price we paid for the bag! I think they let another patient leave with it or the staff stole it, they said they would call me tomorrow after looking for it again. I am going to call the police and report my bag stolen if they don't do what's right and give me my bag back or replace it for the full amout. On top of that they gave him a medication without my approval and he called and told me the place was full of gang members don't send your kids here!!!

name: Bobby Scott
text: I almost died here, I was locked in a room with no bathroom, the heater was broke and they repeatedly told me the heat was just fine. Some of my personal items were "Lost" I have ptsd and this place made sure to go out of their way to harm me. My meds were never correct, so that entirely messed me up. The day I left this place is the day my life started. I can't even describe the depth of this prison. Instead of treatment for ptsd and other things, I received  nothing but hate and they made sure they showed it. They don't care about anyone so please from the very depth of my heart, take your loved ones some place other than this living HELL.

name: angela weatherly
text: Aweful a horrible place to work they are prejudice and ghetto. A place that will set you up to get rid if you. Will document lies and put it on the kids because noone is suppose to question the kids.Will have other techs social workers and therapist join them on a crusade for you to loose your job. I know all people need a job but this one is not worth the hell you go through and if you are not good at being in clicks hillcrest in birmingham alabama is not where you want to be.

name: Grym Reiper
text:
All negative reviews for this facility were scrubbed by GOOGLE at the request of UHS.
Do not go to any UHS facility.
You have been warned

name: me me
text: I work at hillcrest , ive been here for 3 years, the CEO Steve McCabe is a really nasty person, he treats staff really badly, he talks to you like you are nothing. The cafeteria was just shut down by the state because  visitors saw rats and roaches crawling across the floor on more than one occasion, they remodeled the kitchen, but after about 7pm u can hear the rats crawling in the ceiling, I've witnessed a roach falling into grits and the chef picking it out then serving them, there are some good staff at Hillcrest but most of us dont really do our part because we are under paid average salary is 9.00 and not appreciated. A lot of people complain about the D.o.n. Bridget Bishop, she has a really nasty attitude, The HR lady Catherine is a mean mean old hag that tries to tell you how to do you job and she hasn't dealt with patients since Noah built the Ark. But anyway if I had a choice I would choose brook wood, st. Vincent or grand view, too many other good choices out there,  then to go to the hood

name: Cole Hollis
text: I must inform people of this deceiving place. I came here to get help, which I did not get. They write prescription meds to anyone who says they need them, can't sleep etc. I spent 8 days here and it was one of the most traumatic experiences of my life. It did more phsycogical damage to me than I can write into words. No one deserves to be sent here against their will.

name: Lawrence Jones
text: I was a patient at this hospital its a unsafe eviorment there are fights ,rude staff members, and buggers on the wall

resp.text: Hello, we would like the opportunity to address this. Please reach out to us at http://www.hillcrestbhs.com/contact-us/.

name: cakebear 333
text: i did not have a good experience with the inpatient care they gave my 6 yr old, they didnt care for his hygiene needs, he had on same clothes two days in a row when i visited him, no socks, no underwear, ear was draining, they didnt care, my child will NEVER go back there, but his out patient dr is wonderful

name: Meagan Trentham
text: My brothers was at Hill crest an every chance the staff got to verbally an physically abuse them they did this place need to be shut down

name: Hannah Kayy
text: This is the worst place ever I was there a month and had a staff member abuse my roommate in front of me while everyone else was sleeping and not to mention it was a guy that done it she had harmed herself so I went to get a nurse and they came back with a shot and that big tall man came in our room and hit her face on the bed and kept doing it the other people had to tell him to stop the next day me and her had to talk about what had happened to a lady because we filed a report or at least we tried not to mention this place is dirty and old and the nurses are rude I wouldn’t send my worst enemy here they make patients with real mental issues sleep on the floor on their mattress with a sheet I mean the staff there is awful and they don’t help at all and we didn’t even really have group therapy...

name: Her Daddy
text: A useless waste of funds. This place is a joke even for the mental health system. Every staff member is a complete moron.

name: LUVLE LEO
text: The worst place EVER! Ghetto Ratchet Facility😒🤦🏽‍♀️

name: Mark Postell
text: I will never forget what happened to me here on July 4th 2006...Questions ? Email me. I will say this, I almost died there .

name: lamontize fincher
text: This place ruined my life from the time I was very young up until now in my adult years.....Please don't send any of your loved ones here.

name: Grant Young
text: Staff were homophobic and also belittled the patients.

name: Patty Yarbrough
text: horrible i wouldn't put my dog here

name: RC .70 years ago
text: Horrible place, still traumatized until this day.

name: Gab Yarbrough
text: This hospital needs to be shut down it's horrible

text: The staff is the worst they pushed me to snap

name: Gabriel Yarbrough
text: This is a bad hospital in a bad part of town go elsewhere

text: worst place ever

name: G
text: 😮😯Wow

resp.text: Hi, thank you for taking the time to reach out to us. We would like to get some more details about your experience with us so that we can further look into your concerns. So that we can follow up with you directly, please provide us with your contact information by visiting http://www.hillcrestbhs.com/contact-us/. Thank you again for bringing your concerns to our attention.

name: A Dana
text: I've had a wonderful counselor here for 2 years. Highly recommend!

name: Autumn May
text: I was recommended to call this place but after calling all week about services they never return phone calls, even with voicemails left! I’ll find some other services.

name: Maitri Ganguly
text: My counselor was Elizabeth and I wanted someone to help me gather all my strength and fight back. She was able to peek deep inside me and could address the points I needed. It's been about 2yrs and I still remember everything she told me and I still practice them.

name: Ellie Banks
text: I have had a great experience with Oasis. My therapist, Leah, is very comforting, kind and attentive. I've always had positive interactions with the office staff and I would definitely recommend.

name: Krissy Cinnamon
text: Completely disgusted by the way I was treated here. They are supposed to be “non profit,” but all they care about is money. My therapist retired without even telling me. I requested off work 2 weeks in advance to see another person. They “randomly” do a file check 30 MINUTES before an appointment in which I desperately needed help. Since I didn’t have the amount of money they wanted (I borrowed enough to get there from a friend), they cancelled my appointment and left me in tears and gave me no other options for who to call. If I had plenty of money to give them, I’m sure they would have found a way to see me. Also, SHAME on Mrs. Player for retiring and not even telling me. Really inconsiderate and money hungry despite the fact that they get proper funding and should see low income people needing help. I didn’t get it here.......

name: Kristina Blackmon
text: What's in a name? Everything. This place is an oasis. The people here are nice. Its a judgement free place and i always leave refreshed.

name: Ambra Richardson
text: Awesome place. I didnt feel out of place or judged. I was able to open up and let things out and left with a smile on my face and feeling much better than I did.

name: Kara
text: My young daughter has benefited immensely from counseling here and she looks forward to going all the time. They work with my low income so we can easily afford to come regularly.

name: R Heffner
text: Near uab

name: Lucas Fenstermacher
text: Went here years ago, wouldn't be here today if not for Dr. Avery Berry he helped me out a lot didn't judge me once and took his time to try to understand me and my thoughts, he saw me as human being and not as a crazy person the way my last therapist did elsewhere because of him I am able to cope with having bipolar disorder better than I was before. I'd recommend this place to anyone.

name: CHLOE CROSKEY
text:
The website for this company has no integrity.  The employees would NOT tell me (Michelle Croskey) who the CEO/President name.  This company is Not professional. Can someone have one these people to call me or give me there phone number.
Duncan McRae, Jr. M.D., President
Pete Cobb, J.D., Vice President
Elizabeth DuBard, Secretary
Steve Rutledge, Treasurer
Jessica Taylor, J.D., Immediate Past President

name: Rebecca Varner
text: I took my granddaughter’s here to see someone and they really were very helpful and the girls loved their therapist and it really seemed to help them. They are very helpful if we you really are having problems and need help. They don’t take insurance but you pay cash and they will give you a receipt to for you to file with your insurance.

name: Debi Goodman
text: I have seen 2 of the counselors here over the last 10 years. Another family member has seen a third. We have been extremely happy with all 3. The staff is professional but makes you feel like family. There is no judgement. They are faith based, but you decide whether or not you want that to be part of your program. I would reccomend this group to anyone of any age who needs someone to help them work  through  something. They take all major insurance and have a payment plan if you are uninsured.

name: shelbly1
text: I absolutely love the counselor I see here! She is so kind and caring. Helpful and compassionate about what you're dealing with.

name: Scott McNelley
text: This is a wonderful resource for so many in the River Region. Compassionate counseling and help provided by a very talented staff.

name: Genoc Genesis
text: I see Maggie Kellar and her nurse Mackenzie. They are both fantastic and very personable. I drive 45 minutes just to see them specifically. My experience with Mrs.Kellar is the best doctor/patient experience I have ever had. As long as the both of them are there I will always come back.

resp.text:
We appreciate the five-star review. Thank you for taking the time. I share this with the team!
Kindly,
April

name: melody galloway
text: Wonderful clinical staff.  Love love LOVE Dr. Lona!  She's intuitive and kind always.

resp.text:
Melody, thank you for taking the time to leave us a review. We appreciate your kind words and I will share them with the team.
Kindly,
April

name: Mark Gotschall
text: This place is so much the improvement over the Mobile location.  Miss Anita has always taken good care of me.

resp.text:
We appreciate the review and value your feedback. Thanks for taking the time. I will share it with our team!
Kindly,
April

name: Bernard Doug Cook
text: Seeing a therapist there, Barbara Lee, she's pretty good.

resp.text:
Hi Bernard, thank you so much for the review. I am happy to hear you've had a positive experience at BayView. I will share your feedback with our team!
Kindly,
April

name: Paula D
text: I love this office! I recently had my first appointment there in the office with Ms. kellar. The nurse mckenzie and ms Keller we’re both very kind and i could tell they really cared about me and my mental health. As long as dr kellar and McKenzie are there i will continue to come.

resp.text:
So glad you had a great experience, Paula. I will share your feedback and praise with our team. Have a wonderful day!
April

name: Gail GULF SHORES
text: So far so good for the excellent help I've got online with KATHERINE DAVIS. She is a very compassionate employee,  "goes the extra mile ". So helpful with any questions.  A keeper.

resp.text:
Hi, Gail! Thank you for the five-star review. We appreciate your kind words.
Sincerely,
April

name: Sandi Cushway
text: They completely changed my medications that I have been stable on for over 15 years (with not ever having to increase ANYTHING).  I have only seen the PA twice and she was pretty nice.  There seems to be little concern for what I, as their patient, am going through every single day as a result of their decisions.  They are making matters worse for me mentally to where I am barely functional at home or work.  The only reason I gave two stars is for the nurse, Anita.

resp.text:
Sandi, I am sorry to hear we did not meet your expectations. Your feedback will help us improve our services. If there is anything further you wish to add you can reach a member of our patient relations department at info@altapointe.org.
Kindly,
April

name: Billiam Quine
text: They have an issue with making sure their records are up to date. Their staff isn’t helpful and I’m not sure they could be even if they wanted to. Lots of “Its not my problem” going on there. Find someone else to see. Just because they may be the biggest certainly doesn’t mean they are the best.

resp.text:
Hi, Billiam. I am sorry to hear we did not meet your expectations of care. We appreciate the feedback because it will help us improve our care. If you would like to share more about your experience you can send an email to info@altapointe.org or reach our Patient Relations department at (833) 921-1811.
Kindly,
April

name: Serena kay
text: I found a place where I could get help for my autistic son that's transitioning into adulthood. It's nice to have a place we can call and talk to and get help with medications without coming across as different or weird.  They deal with these things on a daily basis and it feels good to be understood.

resp.text:
Hi, Serena Kay. Thank you for the five-star review. We appreciate you and your feedback.
Sincerely,
April

name: Shae McIntyre
text: First of all it took 3 months to get in to see a nurse practitioner to try to get different medication for my anxiety. Second, I finally get to my appointment and because I have shingles (which is a. Only contagious when the fluid in the blisters are touched but b. All of my stuff was covered and wrapped up) they said they would need to do a full decontamination sweep and I would have to get the clearance from my doctor before I can be seen  . So I spent an hour there waiting just to hear I'm the plague basically. I've never felt so offended. I already cant go to my own brothers wedding because of it but now this. I'm furious.

resp.text:
Shae, I am very sorry to hear we did not meet your expectations of care. Your feedback will help us improve our services. If you would like to provide us with additional information, you can speak to someone in our patient relations department by calling (833) 921-1810.
Kindly,
April

name: Juli Norman
text: Some of the most unkind judgmental unprofessional human beings I’ve ever met. Worst money I ever spent looking for help. Went here due to my doctor no longer being in practice and instead of getting back on my regular medications I Was accused of being under the influence by the NP I saw, being two days post op. She stated “you seem drowsy and irritable” I’m tired and in pain (since I was driving I couldn’t take my pain medication). The woman who took me back for my weight and BP answered her phone and began screaming at someone about what only I can assume was her boyfriend cheating on her. Not a single employee looked at me with a smile or made me feel welcome in the slightest. These woman look at you and judge you, they didn’t even talk to me before I felt like I wanted to run out of that building. I just wish I had read reviews before giving them my money.

resp.text:
Juli,  thanks for sharing your feedback. I am sorry your experience didn’t match your expectations. Your feedback will help us improve. Please feel free to reach out to our Patient Relations department (833) 921-1811 with any further comments, concerns, or suggestions you wish to share.
Kindly,
April

name: Ingrid Hartman
text: My family’s experience has always great!  The location is convenient, the medical staff thorough and the clinicians spend the time needed. Thank you!

resp.text: Hi, Ingrid! Thank you for the five-star review. It is our goal to deliver the utmost in care to our patients and their families so they can live their best lives.

name: Christa Bailey
text: People who come to BayView for help have issues. I was 2 minutes late and had to check in (wait for 6 minutes in line because a computer was down and I was standing there not knowing what to do and nobody would even look at me). I was told that I was 10 minutes late and my appointment is only 20 minutes long so I could reschedule or the doctor would work me in -of course I will have a no-show fee. I have never been here and not had to wait 15 minutes to see doc-I guess it’s a one way street.

name: Samantha Wade Caraway
text: DO NOT GO TO BAYVIEW! THESE PEOPLE DO NOT CARE ABOUT THEIR PATIENTS! They can not even file insurance correctly. If you don't agree with them, they will refuse to do ANYTHING for you. Their only option is to increase meds that do not work or put the patient in the hospital. If I could put ZERO stars, I would!

name: Richard Vin Zant
text: Yeah worst record keeping of any business I’ve been too.

resp.text:
Hi, Richard. I am sorry to hear we did not meet your expectations. Your feedback will help us improve our services. If you would like to provide any further information, please email us at info@altapointe.org
April

name: Caitlin Shostak Lotz
text: If you feel frustrated and misunderstood by "most" therapists, I would highly recommend Joel. He has a sixth sense for understanding people and the ability to tap into the best thing about them. I have the privilege of knowing Joel personally. I can attest that he is truly a brilliant, imaginative and original thinker.

name: Caleb Young
text: Joel is such a warm, witty and compassionate human being. Anyone seeking a therapist that will truly see you as a person can stop searching cause you’ve find him. 5/5 and I actively recommend to friends and family.

name: Andy Philpo
text: Joel is an insightful and intelligent human being who you can trust to help you process and understand the complexities of your inner self. Come away deeper self knowledge and self mastery, which in turn leads you to a more peaceful life and more fulfilling personal or professional relationships.

name: Andrew Lotz
text: Joel is the most empathetic and intelligent person I know. He has an uncanny ability to understand people. If you need someone to really "get you," this is the place.

name: Wil Heflin
text: Joel Blackstock is a talented, kind, and empathetic therapist. He is clearly passionate about helping others and wants the best for his clients’ outcomes. He is trained in EMDR to help with ptsd and incorporates it along with his years of experience into the process.

name: Jonathan Chesney
text: Joel is thoughtful, curious, insightful, well-trained, and cares deeply about people in general and his patients health and well-being  in specific.  If you’ve been considering therapy and counseling, or just need to talk to someone about how those things might help, I recommend giving him a try!

name: Thomas Kozak
text: No pre-formed assumptions here.  Joel Blackstock meets you where you're at, and he responds to the unique nuances of every individual.

name: Teria Fuller
text: Joel is extremely trustworthy.   I feel free to talk with him about anything and not be judged.

name: Whitney Barnes
text: We really do not like this place. We feel like a bother and they try to do SO much through one office. It is a mess.

resp.text:
Hi, Whitney! I apologize for not meeting your expectations. I appreciate you taking the time to leave a review. I will share feedback with management.
Kindly,
April

name: robin matthews
text: My son has been going here for about 11 years, I have seen no change in his behavior, they change up on Therapist and Doctors as quick as my Son gets comfortable with one. As far as medicine refills, you have to stay on top of this. Now as of tonight my Son does not have his night medicine, and I have called off and on for a week.

resp.text:
Hi, Robin. I am sorry to hear we have not met your expectations. We value your feedback because it will help us get better. If you would like to send more, you can reach us at infor@altapointe.org.
Thank you,
April

name: cora beth
text: I went there for depression and they didn't help me at all. Yes I am young and I feel the need to tell your children,  friends, or family do not go there. It makes you uncomfortable and there were cockroaches in my bed and all around horrible. The workers yell at night down the halls, and they are horrible to children. It did not help me at all. I went there in January and talking about this place still makes me cry. Imagine someone younger going there. Think how long they will be crying over this place . If you love who you are considering going to Alta Point, I beg you don’t make them go through hell.

resp.text: Hi, Cora Beth. I am sorry to hear we did not meet your expectations for care. We value your feedback because it will help us improve our services. If you would like to send additional information you can email info@altapointe.org    Thank you, April

text: So sad called on Thursday for refills & pharmacy nurse called today said needed appointment scheduled appointment for Wednesday to find out it has to be another 48hours then takes so long to get a live person on phone

resp.text:
Hi Nedra. I am sorry to hear we did not meet your expectations. I do appreciate the feedback because it will help us improve our quality of care. Thank you for taking the time to reach out.
Kindly,
April

name: Matthew Clarkson
text: I absolutely love this place. My therapist is super nice, and she actually takes the time to talk to me on how to fix my problems. I went there for depression, and it has helped a lot.

resp.text: Hi, Matthew! Thank you for the five-star review! April

name: Gina Holland
text: I absolutely hate this place. Didn't even help my child just wanted to dope him up on antidepressants.

resp.text:
Hi Gina,
We appreciate your feedback and hope to resolve any issues you may have faced. Our office strives to provide the best care possible. To adequately address the problems you listed, we need more information. If you would like to provide more detail on the matter, please call (251) 450-4303 or email info@altapointe.org. Thank you.

name: Kalli Webb

name: Chalis Love
text: Unfortunately I did not have a great experience with my "therapist". Wish I could say better , I was meeting with Pamela Callaghan for therapy, I had missed a scheduled visit and received a NOT SO HAPPY call from Pamela, she stated she wish I would have called the office to cancel instead of missing the virtual appointment I told her I wanted to pay for my previous bill first to which she replied " Are you still working?" I answered yes. She asked if I was still taking medication i replied yes for anxiety and she said " SOUNDS LIKE YOU NEED ANTIDEPRESSANTS" . Its nice to know if your at work and miss a virtual visit with your therapist you will be judged and labeled depressed with no Apology. Would not recommend.

name: Lisa Hallmon
text: I wouldn’t even give one star. My mom was admitted to Shelby Hospital for psychological reasons. She could walk and talk before entering. After being put on extreme medication from Alabama Psychiatry facility, my mother couldn’t talk nor walk. She has been in the hospital now for over a month. She is finally talking and her mind is coming back slowly. She still can not walk. She has been to 3 hospitals where they said my mother was highly over medicated and she has Parkinsonism from way to much antipsychotic medication. Alabama Psychiatry Doctors put her on all them. This has been so hard. I am now dealing with depression and stress as well over all of this. Do not let your loved ones go to this place! They will way over medicate. I also had spoke to the doctor about feeling that my mom was way over medicated and she just Dropped her down one dose but then added an antidepressant.  It’s been a complete change in my moms life. A horrible change!!! Another hospital is trying to get her medication corrected where hopefully she will be able to get back to normal and walk again

name: Bree B
text: Dr. Chowhurdy is an angel. I have been seeing psychiatrist for ten years, and she is the first I’ve felt truly comfortable being open with. She saved my life, and in turn I will now be well wnough to be a wonderful mom

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review

text: If it were not for the doctor I see I would certainly go somewhere else!  The front desk “girls” do not know what they are doing nor do they know how to treat people with respect and dignity. text: The Dr’s are very helpful and nice but your front office staff other than the 1 lady that I believe is new is horrific. The heavy set blond lady was VERY rude about my account talking to me in front of everyone about my balance. This is something that should be kept private. text: Worst place ever. The young lady at the window was very kind however, she is the only bright spot. Other were standing around talking while everyone in the lobby was standing in line. name: Jean-Paul Bootier
text: Great staff and wonderful doctors. Never had a bad experience

name: Rhiannon Perkins
text: This was the most disappointing experience I have ever experienced EVER! I’ve been to some sh*t doctors before but I’ve never had to deal with such idiocracy before in my life. My husband was a patient with them and has had great success so I made an appointment after hearing good reviews from him and also another family member. I made an appointment a week before and two days before they called to tell me that they had to change my doctor due to a “conflict of interest”. Meaning it was my husband’s therapist and they wanted me to see the other therapist available. I agreed and set the appointment for later in the day. The day came for my appointment and I receive a call from the therapist saying that she wouldn’t be able to see me either for the same reason even though my other family member had STOPPED seeing her. She said she would call me back after I told her to go ahead and cancel my appointment. Never received a call. I showed up at the office 30 minutes early and she asked to see me in her office where she tried to further explain the “conflict of interest” that they kept referring to. I told her I could find a place closer to home that wouldn’t turn someone away who was looking for help. If you’re thinking about going here, make sure no one you know is a patient as well. Otherwise, you might become another “conflict of interest” like me and not be told until you show up because even though they say they called you and got your voicemail. I guess actually LEAVING a voicemail is too complex. I’m not doubting their ability to help, but being turned away at the door when you want help feels like an emotional slap to the face.

name: T Farris
text: The initial physician was great but after that downhill.  I was never told that I would have to have numerous appointments in order to get the testing completed. My appointment with the intake physician was changed 3 times and the last time was due to their issue with getting a THEIR new physician set up.  Still not sure how that is the patient's problem. All I was told was I could go elsewhere but the wait was going to be long. Not really because I was able to get into their office.  Unreal canceled everything and WILL NOT RETURN OR RECOMMEND.  If I could leave 0 stars I would.

name: Devin “Gearhog” Payne
text:
I left an extremely emotional, long, desperate email on my appointment request, and got a call back only a couple days later. The woman I spoke to was kind and genuinely concerned about my well being. She was a little absent minded but that's what I loved about her! Softly humming tunes while trying to track down information, "talking to herself" when she found something ("oh! There it is!" etc)  It made me feel at ease.
I don't know why the reviews are so bad for this place... I've had an amazing experience so far.
As someone who suffers from varying mental disorders, as well as being victim to multiple emotional & sexual traumas, I find it exceptionally difficult to trust; yet I already trust Dr. LaRussa. It's such a relief to finally meet a mental health professional who can see me for who I truly am, and that I'm comfortable enough around to be myself.
Even though he's a psychiatrist, he listened to my rambles and my talking in circles. He offered practical theories, and gave solid advice.... And he seemed to really understand me, suggesting we find a therapist to treat my PTSD. He spoke to me like I'm a human being.

I've only had one appointment so far but Dr. LaRussa is sooo fantastic! He and the rest of the staff seem to genuinely care about the patients. I look forward to my next appointment with him.
If you're someone who's easily threatened, this man is the doctor for you! I've met so many, and none even half as compassionate as Paul LaRussa. His gentle smile alone would make anyone feel at ease.

name: ben guthrie
text: Jennie is great! She's helped me tremendously.

name: Janice Mutchler
text: Inefficient, no regard for customer's time. Waited over an hour to see Dr for a scheduled appointment. Another patient in the waiting room with us signed in and waited an hour and a half, asked what the problem was and only then they figured out her appointment was scheduled for the following day.

name: Haley Davis
text: I went to see Dr. Bodiford for help with my ADHD and instead I was told I'm "too smart" to have ADHD via an IQ test, and I must only have dyscalculia instead. After going to another psychiatrist for a second opinion, I was told I absolutely have ADHD and that IQ tests are not at all a way to determine if a patient has ADHD. I went three years before seeking this second opinion, and in those three years I have struggled with my ADHD more than ever. I am so thankful for the ADHD Clinic in Hoover because Alabama Psychiatry failed me.

resp.text: We apologise if your expectations were not met.  Would you like to speak with the office manager?

name: Lea Roberts
text: Jacob Scott was very kind to me at a time when I needed help.   Covid caused a change in how they delivered care, but it was seemless.   Leigh Ann has been so helpful.   It is a humbling experience to need help...but they never look down on you and truly care about their patients.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review.

name: Chason Burdick
text: Great doctors i really have come a long way with their help they are very caring and careful  love my dr Jacob Scott hes helped me more than he knows I did leave a review that was i thought confidential listing only one issue I had then I got a termination of care letter  I love Dr Scott hes helped me through alot and I pray in his heart that he will see that I really need him and his care more than he ever would know

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review.

The woman upfront has an attitude, if you need a medication refill the nurse will tell you the doctor is out of the office for a week, they will bill you for a charge your not responsible for, and once you see the doctor he doesn't communicate. He was actually yawning while I was talking and showed no interest in what I had to say. He would give me more medication than needed so I wouldn't have to come back so I just stopped going. Although I had insurance and didn't do anything to anyone I guess I wasn't interesting enough to receive treatment.

name: Shaneeda Staples
text: I had to edit my review because after dealing with them for a few years, this is what my experience is.(This review is for the main office on Sydney Curve.) They don't let you know when your doctor/therapist leaves your insurance network causing you to rack up a large bill. They've forgotten me more than once, letting others go back to see the doctor before I do. Back before the old office manager left, I asked them for over a year what's going on with my daughter's copays. I couldn't get a straight answer. Their billing department has been a hot mess. Saying one thing, doing another. They let a large bill rack up and now she can't see the doctor for her meds. The doctors/therapists are great but billing and the receptionists (except Quintella) are a disgrace to anyone in customer service. I'll be so glad when they're paid off. I don't recommend them to anyone. You've been warned...

name: Chissy Valka
text: Do not waist your time here. The whole system they have a HORRIBLE communication issue with each other just to start with. Obviously your contacting this place to help improve mental health where I feel they just made the whole process worse. They didn’t even tell me why they had me see a different person then whom I was scheduled for I had to ask during my appointment, I was asked if I wanted medication without knowing what for, scheduling is a nightmare and they will NOT listen to you about it..about a month out each time AND every time I talked to anyone about it they acted like it was new information, having one of the therapist/counselors whatever you want to call them tell you “ok you have (fill in the blank) and then NOT tell you anything about it but rather say “go home and Google it” isn’t acceptable. Every time myself or my hubby went to see OR call there was issues EVERY TIME. So when I called the main location? To speak to someone higher up…they called me back way too fast to do ANY follow up and research and was nothing but defensive rather then trying to fix a damn thing. I was at work so she gave me a number to call be to which I have tried a few times with no response even after I left a message and another time she even hit the ignore button…she clearly called me back by mistake as it rang once and then she hung up…when I tried to call back I couldn’t get through…never in my life would I say this issue helpful facility. Seek help somewhere else cuz you will not receive it here.

resp.text:
Hi Chissy,

It seems as though you've had a tough time at our clinic. We are so sorry! While I'm sure your experience is frustrating, I can assure you that any action taken by our providers or staff was with the best intent. Though we are certainly not perfect, we at IBH understand the importance of providing exceptional healthcare and kind service and pride ourselves on our talented providers and friendly staff. If we did not live up to this expectation, we sincerely apologize. We would love a chance to discuss this with you further, so if you would please email us at customerservice@ibhus.com, we can chat with you about how to better serve you and your husband moving forward.

Thanks

Hi Ellen,

Thanks so much! We are proud to serve our community responsibly and diligently and we thank you for noticing and appreciating our work. We are thrilled to be able to serve you :)

name: Anita Brown
text: Love Love Love this office. They are very welcoming. The front office staff is friendly, professional, and caring. I love my therapist and her sweet baby.

resp.text:
Hi Anita!

Thank you so much for your kind words. We appreciate you!

name: Rebecca Pearson
text: Great clinic! Everyone here is very friendly and helpful. I love my new therapist and the nurse practitioner I saw was very knowledgeable. She seems to really care about her patients.

resp.text:
Hi Rebecca!

We are so pleased that you are enjoying your therapist. Thank you for your kind words and for allowing us to serve you!

name: Alyssa H
text: I have to agree with the previous review.  I had high hopes for this place but I was extremely let down.  You will not be seen by a psychiatrist here, just a nurse practitioner who throws prescriptions out by the handful.  Proceed with caution!  Read the labels on this stuff!  The front office is unorganized and unprofessional.  I’m grateful that we have other options because this place is a train wreck and it is a shame there is not more care taken when dealing with patients mental health.

resp.text:
Hi Alyssa,

We are so sorry to hear that you had a poor experience at our office.  Our typical model for intake is that our patients speak with a therapist or nurse practitioner before speaking with a psychiatrist. This is because we are a behavioral health practice, so we strive to provide thorough psychiatric care through both therapy and medication management. Additionally, we are extremely cautious with prescribing medication, so any medication prescribed is only under the recommendation of a highly trained individual who believes that you would benefit from it. That being said, ensuring the stability and improvement of our patients mental wellbeing is our primary concern, so we apologize if we were unable to meet your needs. Please email us at customerservice@ibhus.com to discuss how we may better serve you moving forward!

name: Jeffery Wynn
text:
