I would normally not rate a businesses performance so poorly however, a single 🌟 is far too great. I will take the high road and not post names. But let me say for a first visit/interaction I found the office/clerical staff to be extremely unprofessional, I'll informed and overall combative. I should have followed my first instinct and just leave. But morbid curiosity set in and I actually wanted to see how Bad it would really get ( I had really left the afternoon open, so I at this point had no time restraints) I had no idea that by the time I did leave I would have become resentful of the 2 hours of my life that I could never reclaim.
Once the train left the station I found it to become more like a hidden camera reality show. Especially, when the only really delightful individual I encountered was unable to master the skill of getting my vitals. So much that out of the sheer awkwardness, I finally asked if she would like for me to "just provide" my usual blood pressure syst. /dia. data. To which she said please and thank you. She then documented the numbers I gave her and she just guessed what my heart bpm would be. Now let me inject here that I am 52 and have not partook in recreational pharmaceuticals in many many decades. Therefore, I found it oddly expected when this same sweet young lady proceeded to pop on latex gloves and shake the urine specimen I provided right there in the same lobby in view of all other patients (were there to be ANY OTHER PATIENTS).
So I can't say I was completely broadsided when the absurdity of a false positive for wait for it .... Methadone for heven sake. I had to search Google to get a clear understanding of what exactly it was.
By this point now the humor is subsiding and I asked what could cause "clearly a false positive" and to that I was given in what struck me as an Asperger's demeanor, Methadone would cause a Methadone reading. Now you can see why I was growing impatient with the entire experience. And I am completely for time sake, leaving out many other "remarkable" events. Needless to say  I left shortly after that vulgar abuse. Awkward totally and completely toe curling Awkwardness. Oh thank you Google, I saw on the very first answer to my search criteria of WHAT CAUSES FALSE POSITIVE RESULTS FOR METHADONE,IN A GUY WHOM HAS NO REMOTE POSSIBILITY OF INGESTION OF IT. And guess what sports fans, 100 to 200 mgs. Of your basic run of the mill dyphenhydramine
Ie: Benadryl will cause a false positive for you guessed it Methadone.
Now do I have any concerns about the longevity of the Cullman office? Absolutely not. I can guarantee the end result of it. But the frustration of being in a situation in which a "health care provider" is not only giving me utterly impossible, inaccurate and offensive information regarding MY physical/chemical make up, well that is not just concerning, but irrehensible. I'm not certain how I choose to proceed, but I feel obligated to do something. In case you have forgotten by this point, they represent themselves to be providing Mental Health Care. Fortunately, I only needed a local provider for your basic low dose antidepressant and the same meds I have taken on and off my entire life for ADD. But can you even begin to imagine someone with a true need/requirement for accurate, mental health care. I intend to start with BCBS and file a suit with HIPPA. I sincerely will appreciate any and all suggestions or recommendations.
Thanks for anyone's time that may read this lengthy review. However, I have posted a similar review on the actual company website only to have it I'mmediately hidden as well as my own personal social media posts were trolled and somehow hidden. I'm not certain how that's even a thing. But obviously they do not want this information to be in public forum. Hopefully, Google reviews can protect it in only long enough for 1 person to view. Hopefully it is the 1 viewer whom needs the info most.
Sincerely
Jeffery Wynn

resp.text:
Hi Jeffery,

First, let us apologize for the delay in getting back to you. Though this review was posted a little bit ago, patient care is our top concern, so we wanted to take some time to get back to you. While it certainly sounds like your experience at our Cullman clinic was less than ideal, we can assure you that all of our staff is highly trained, competent, and dedicated to providing you with the highest level of care possible. Though we were not there to witness the event you've described, it sounds like a classic case of miscommunication. While we're sure our staff meant no offense, we am still deeply sorry for any inconvenience this incident may have caused. Please email us at customerservice@ibhus.com so that we may apologize personally and discuss with you how we may serve you better moving forward.

name: H G
text:
I am saddened that I cannot give this business a 0 star review. I have crippling anxiety that is induced by time issues and usually I am prepared to go into a doctors office to wait a good while, but waiting 2+ hours for a TELEMEDICINE visit is absolutely ridiculous.

My husband has trying to get me to stop going here for a year because of how the receptionists treat patients and how the doctors are overbooked and therefore do not consider patients time, but because of my anxiety of going to new doctors I have withheld from doing so.

I was having more mental health issues than usual and called to ask a question about my medication, but there is literally no way to get in touch with your doctor, whether it's over the online portal or the telephone. I talked to so many different people with no answers, and when I finally got in touch with someone they said I would have to cancel my monthly appointment in place of this "emergency" appointment. I know doctors are busy and have a lot to do and so much going on, but this is on another level.

I feel so bad for those who go to Psychiatry South in desperate need of help and are greeted with an unwelcoming atmosphere and hours of waiting because of poor planning.

Not only that, but I am on medicine I am uncomfortable with and my doctor has continued me on this medicine knowing that I don't believe I should be on it. I trusted him thinking that he knew what was best, but in reality I shouldn't be on medicine for years that isn't helping just because my doctor is prescribing it to me. I should've stopped the medicine a long time ago myself, but I was too scared of having withdrawals or symptoms like my doctor was telling me I would, so I continued to stay on the medication.

I ignored the Google reviews when I started coming here because someone I trusted came here and had a completely different experience than me somehow. But I'm here to tell you: there is a 1.9 star rating for a REASON. Do not put yourself through this. It's not an exaggeration.

If anything, Pyschiatry South has increased my mental health symptoms greatly and after this experience of waiting for so long like it's absolutely no issue at all, I will never be returning.

name: Jennifer
text: I could not imagine where I would be at this point if I didn't have this place and these people in my life. Kristin has definitely stocked up with the best girls in the front. I can't wait until we can get back in to the waiting area because I'm definitely missing getting to see and talk with the girls up front. Miranda, Anna,  and Taylor are the most welcoming people you could ask for as the first faces a person sees when we come through the door. They are always upbeat even if they have had a struggling day. I love dealing with Trey for my medication needs because he is always so thorough about what is going on in my life and how that can affect my meds. And last but not least, Wes Wilkes, my therapist, has gotten me to a place that I never thought it possible to get when I first started coming to this group. I have even been able to find ways of overcoming my anxiety symptoms that I've dealt with since I was in high school. I love where I'm at and where I'm going and these guys have played and continue to play a huge role in this recovery. I owe them more than I could ever repay and I thank God He has placed all of them in my life and in my recovery.

name: Lisa Wilson
text: The appoints are always late like 45 minutes to over an hour. Then they make you wait weeks to get another appointment when you can’t wait on the phone all day. The staff is extremely rude, no one is apologetic. Do not give them your business!!!

name: Abigail Calhoun
text: The reception staff does not relate any information with you, nor do they bother to call/email updates on policies or doctor absences. I have had two providers leave the practice and I was not told they had left or had my appointments updated. They did not correctly email me information despite my telling them that I was not getting their emails. They repeatedly charged late fees despite them admitting their own mistakes. They do not have good communication and patient care is lacking.

name: Benita Hughes Cahalane
text:
receptionist very rude on multiple calls
Went to group 18 months never saw a Psychiatrist!
Trey Maddox was excellent, when he left other NP was cold.
Appointment were randomly made and sent to email
Patient should not be responsible for appoints that are not followed by a call, especially when Patient had no acknowledgement of appointment. So unfair.
Over medicated!
Would not recommend this group to anyone

name: Brennan Waters
text: If you miss an appointment they send a nice little letter saying they don't want to work with you and you need to find alternative treatment. Extremely petty. Good job guys!

name: Elizabeth Smith
text: I love all of the doctors here that I have interacted with. However, expect at least an hour wait whether you are visiting the actual office or if you are meeting via telemed. This has been the same for YEARS. I have been coming to Psychiatry South for 7 years now. I have never been back before an hour after my appointment time.

name: Amy Edge
text:
If I could give this place a zero I would. Terrible. Unprofessional, Unorganized and Waited over 2 hours for a Scheduled Appointment. My Regular Psychiatrist left here. They never called to let me know. I had to Wait weeks to get in with a new Dr.
Will definitely advise you to stay away from this place. I will not be back.

name: Isabelle VanVactor
text: In my opinion they do not care about there patients. I was dropped and never called to tell me anything or even why. Meanwhile waiting on a medication refill and was left with none. I went to taking a depression medication for over 10 years to stopping cold turkey. In my opinion what caring Dr. does that?

name: Suzy T
text: I just called and made my first appointment, Miranda made my appointment was super nice.  I have search for months trying to find a good place to go and I was referred to them  by Dr. Cleary's office.  I feel very confident with this decision.  Due to covid most places have closed and are only doing telehealth.  I am relived to find someone that can help me.

resp.text: Thank you so much! We look forward to partnering with you for care.

name: Van Vanvactor
text: My opinion they don't care about the clients all they care about is your money terrible company

name: Alyson Usher
text: This place does not care about their patients at all!  I have been a patient there for a couple of months. I am on medication that will cause me to have withdrawals if I don’t take it.  Today when getting ready for my appointment, I realized I had. It paid my co-pay yet. I called immediately when I went to my email and saw the invoice was cancelled. Mind you my appt is at 1:30 and it is 10;30. They told me that I could not pay it and that they had canceled my appt and put someone else in my a lot without even calling me! Someone who cares about their patients doesn’t do this! I pleaded with the secretary to let me pay and still come to my appt. her response was that this was my fault this happened and they would not have an appt until April 20th. No care I’m her voice whatsoever!  These people are awful!

name: peyton mastropolo
text: Trying to get in touch with anybody who works here. I’ve tried to pay my bill for months ( since January) and no one will answer my calls I’ve left plenty of messages. Last time psychiatrist saw me she never rescheduled my appointment bc I hadn’t paid bill yet, she said they would call me back and they never did. ( I actually called them that day and 0 answer ) Unfair for me bc ive been a patient for 2 1/2 years and seems bizarre that the billing department doesn’t answer or return calls. Cant even go in building ( at least when I went in January) bc of Covid restrictions. Not sure if it’s that way now. It’s not cool to just have someone as a patient and then completely ignore them and there treatment plan.

name: Morgen Stone
text:
Horrible service.  My NP left the practice, and instead of Psychiatry South reaching out to all of his patients, they just cancelled all of his future appointments.

If I hadn't called, I would have shown up for my appointment next week and been turned away.

Mental health is so important, and this practice does NOT care about its patients.

name: Jacqueline Brown
text:
Absolutely the rudest receptionist/scheduler I have ever spoken with. My wife (a PA) called to make my brother an appointment because he is far too depressed to call a million offices and get turned away. The person who picked up the phone does not introduce herself, is immediately rude, and absolutely does not want to do her job. She is very inconvenienced to be even answering the phone, clearly.

First she tells us no one is available to accept new patients and that we should just expect that anywhere we call. So, my brother doesn’t matter and neither do any other people suffering with mental health? Got it.

So my wife asks “no one in your entire staff is available, even an NP or PA?” Oh yeah, well they’re available in May. So we were just lied to, real cute.

She then proceeds to refuse to allow my wife to book the appointment because it’s a “HIPAA violation.”INCORRECT. Again, my wife is a PA and knows the law. Not to mention 30 minutes before this horrible phone call she made him an appointment through UAB for a PCP. And she does this ALL the time for her own patients.

Get your staff in order. Business is literally being refused. Not acceptable in any specialty, yet alone Psych.

HIPAA Privacy states,
“Appointment Making by Other Than the Patient
Appointments arranged by someone other than the patient are not a violation of HIPAA privacy rules.“

resp.text: Our office policy is that if an adult person wishes to seek treatment, he/she must initiate treatment themselves, unless their is a physical or mental issue that would prevent he/she from doing so and a medical POA exists.  Unfortunately we, and many other psychiatric offices, receive requests for treatment from family members and friends of potential patients who are not ready to seek treatment, therefore by us speaking to the adult we can confirm their desire to have the appointment, discuss what the available options are for treatment, expectations, etc. and determine if outpatient care is even appropriate for the symptoms or issues the patient is having at that current time or if a higher level of care (inpatient) recommendation is more appropriate.   Not all of our providers are taking new patients at the moment, that is correct.  Some of our providers who are taking new patients, may only be able to take patients they are allowed by licensure to see or approved by the insurance carrier (all things discussed with the patient of record).   We are currently booking into May/June at the current time, that is also true. By speaking with a potential patient and getting the required history we can avoid a potential issue with delaying of care if they are not appropriate for outpatient care at the current time. "Business is not being refused," however we have to make sure we can meet the needs of the patient and that the patient he or herself is ready and appropriate for outpatient treatment.  As a family member, you do have options for seeking mental healthcare if the patient refuses, through the probate court system in your county.

name: Outrage Outlet
text:
Reading the reviews, I cannot BELIEVE that the same issues I am currently facing have been happening for so many years!
First of all, the responses of other VALID reviews being “I’m sorry you feel that way” and “You may have the wrong practice” is so embarrassing for them. Instead of using your time to write unprofessional responses, you could accept the constructive criticism and make changes at the practice.
The office staff is rude and unprofessional. I understand that they are currently working from home, but I couldn’t even hear the lady over the crying/screaming children in the background. When I (finally) got an appointment, I waited for well over an hour. I had to pay for a drug test, which I thought was a little strange. They scheduled a follow up appointment (which I didn’t know about), and sent me an invoice. The online portal is SO CONFUSING. I can’t even imagine how older people would be able to figure it out. I have called with no answer. Left a voicemail for scheduling, and they didn’t return my call after 7 days. When I finally got ahold of someone, there were no available appointments for a month.

(Please do not say that I cannot be identified as a client, as I am protecting my identity.)

name: Heather
text:
PLEASE read before making an appointment at this office. I have been going to the Psychiatry South for about a year. I have had countless issues. My last appointment was my breaking point. I received a message on the patient portal right before my appointment time stating that my doctor was no longer seeing patients for the type of appointment I would need. I already requested time off of work for this appointment. The office said they would call in my prescription (which is a 3 month prescription) and get back to me about scheduling with another doctor. A month goes by I still haven’t heard from the office and I go to pick up my prescription and the pharmacy doesn’t have anything for me. They did call in the prescription but only for one months worth instead of 3 months. I called the office and they forward me to the nurses line which they NEVER answer.I left a voicemail then I called back later in the day to see what I should do about my prescription because I am completely out. The receptionist was extremely rude and I felt like I was being rushed off the phone. By the end of the call I attempted to ask if they could please get back to me at the end of the day to tell me what I should do (considering I had already been waiting for a month to hear back from them)Before I could even try to complete that sentence I was hung up on. I called back another lady answered who was helpful and kind but said they couldn’t get me in for another 3 weeks. ***That’s 3 weeks without the medication that I have been taking everyday since I was a child.** she did say shes going to try to get my medicine called in to get me by for those 3 weeks. Unfortunately I did not hear anything back. On top of that they no longer take my insurance which was brought to my attention today so I explained to them I would pay full price until I could find another doctor I am in network with just to get me by. Had they of told me a month ago they would no longer have a doctor in network with my insurance I could have planned and had time to find another office that accepts my insurance instead of being in this situation and risking my mental health.

Billing is a nightmare, in the past they have charged me for missed appointments when the office had changed my appointment and failed to call and let me know. Because of previous issues I started saving all of my emails and voicemails to prove my original appointment times. It took months to get them to
take the missed appointment fee off of my account.

Lastly a couple months ago I called the office to schedule an appointment. The receptionist asked me who my doctor was. I had recently switched to a new doctor because my previous one left the office. I told the receptionist I couldn’t remember, the line went silent. I then remembered the doctors first name because I thought that might help. The receptionist (I’m not exaggerating) yelled at me and called me SO disrespectful for addressing a doctor by their first name. I was in absolute shock that they would yell at a patient and call them disrespectful instead of simply looking up my name in the computer and seeing who I had seen my last couple appointments. After numerous issues with the office I tried to speak with the office manager. it was voicemail every time I called. She did finally reach out after I had left multiple voicemails. When she called I was unfortunately at work. I do not carry my cellphone on me during work hours. I called her back, left another voicemail and explained to her my work hours 6:30-4 and asked if there was anyway she could call after 4 or tell me a good time to call her and I could step in the back at work to take the call. I didn’t think that would be a problem considering the offices closes at 5. After countless times of trying to get ahold of her I gave up.

This is the first negative review I have ever left for any office I have been to. I’m writing this in hopes no one else has to through what I have. All this office has done is cause me stress and anxiety.

name: Kay Burns
text:
The billing office is horrible. I have been calling for the last 3 months about a bill that my health insurance is requesting medical records on for my daughter but they have not returned the call or sent the medical records but they want me to pay the bill. I have contacted the administration with no call back. If you want to pay bills that your insurance is requesting information from the provider then this it the place to go to.  They do not return calls to patients. So sad. They cant use the HIPPA excuse because they have failed to call her to discuss the bill and what they are doing about sending the medical records for a bill. The doctor my daughter sees is an excellent doctor however they need to revamp their staff for office/billing.

Edit: to respond to the statement from the office. My adult daughter has made calls as well with no response on the claim. You can blame a pandemic on all issues however the pandemic is not stopping you from responding to this review. The same way you responded to the review your billing staff should respond to your patients.  It is not a HIPPA issue because you are not responding to the patient. If the medical billing department is handling that situation then your staff needs to respond to your patient to inform them that the bill was sent back to be reprocess. I can go all day with this due to I am a medical Biller so I do know the process. I have to call patients and respond to their request and my patient do not  have to wait on me to never return their calls.  Since you are responding take notes to do better and stop making excuses. Its to many negative reviews regarding the same sitution. ACKNOWLEDGE YOUR FAULTS AND DO BETTER!!

A voicemail was left this morning with Administration for the second time with no return call from the message on 1-7-21.  Search the last name in your system, you will find my daughter or better yet, leave your name and she will call you to resolve the problem.

resp.text: We only see adults in our practice, so how old is your daughter? I asked to make sure that you have the right practice. Typically we find our patients call themselves regarding their financial and treatment matters. There may be a HIPAA issue in fact if you are calling on behalf of your adult child and they do not have you on the release where we would be able to provide information or speak with you.  Additionally if an insurance company is requesting records to pay a claim that request of records is sent to our medical records company and they keep a very detailed list of request and what is sent. What may be happening is that they need older records to verify diagnosis, etc. to determine payment on a claim which wouldn’t come to our office. All of this is very general information because the accusations made in this review maybe incomplete or not factual. Our practice is not perfect. No one’s medical practice in 2020-2021 can be . We are still in the middle of a pandemic and our priority is to the health and safety of our patients and our staff. I apologize that you feel this way about our practice however please have your adult child call us to inquire about the accusations you made above so that we can make sure that you all have the correct practice and that there is nothing preventing us from speaking with you otherwise. Of note I am not able to identify anyone within the practice that makes the poster of this review.

name: Brandon Jackson
text: I honest cannot believe how they treat their patients. They were having tech difficultly with the remote appt(Little do they know i'm an electrical engineer) and they just skipped my appt and blamed me for it. When in fact I could see dr.suggs, joining but the camera was not working on his end(Join and left a few times). Then they continue to say its my fault. On top that, my friends just committed suicide and another OD'd a few weeks ago. They finally reschedule my appt then on the day before(today) they discharged me. All i wanted was help for my mental health......  and they're far from providing it. This photo below is after waiting 45 minute after the schedule appt. I HIGHLY ADVISE NOT TO GO HERE

name: Amy Hester
text: Rudeness and insensitivity EVERY TIME we visited this practice. It takes days to return calls and then spoken to as if you aren’t even human.

name: Lauren Garrett
text: I have been with this practice for about a year. Dr. Sugg is attentive and kind and you can tell he truly wants to help. Unfortunately, the front office staff is the worst and I’m still currently waiting on a call back from a nurse from 7 days ago (which happens every single time I call a nurse) Dr. Sugg is worth seeing but be prepared for an absolute train wreck of a staff.

resp.text: I apologize. With our new phone system we are able to retrieve call history in an effort to minimize errors like these. The nurse's area is separate of that of the front office staff/scheduling staff. I will certainly check into potentially missing your call/message from the nurse's perspective.  Please feel free to call our Administrator, Kristin, at 205-987-0724.  With the pandemic our office operations on the phones and portal messages has increased 4x over, however we want to provide the most quality care as possible. Thank you.

name: Amanda L
text:
This is the best experience I’ve *ever* had with a psychiatrist. Hands down. I find Dr Sugg to be warm and kind, unlike many Psychs. He brilliantly diagnosed me with something no one else had ever seen in my 20 years of mental health care. It’s honestly a life changing shift!

In regards to the staff- I find them to be remarkable as well. They are not rude at all. In fact, at one point they were concerned about me and called to check up on me. How many other psychiatrists office would do that?!

They are managing a huge patient load both in person and on the phones. (Can we give them a little credit for having to deal with psychiatric patients all day every day?😂🤦🏻‍♀️)

I have had a significant wait time. To me, it’s worth it to get this level and quality of care.

resp.text: Thank you so very much for your kind review! We truly appreciate it.  Your insight is kind and honest.  While we know we can always improve and strive to do better, we are genuinely committed to our patients and clients improvement and care.

name: Sweet Home Alamanda
text: Hi! I just wanted to stop by and leave a review after seeing some of the other reviews because I have had a VERY GOOD experience here. I'm sure as pts, we have different experiences but I can definitely say that mine has been pretty top-notch. Terry Maddox is AMAZING and I am very pleased with the help I'm receiving through Psychiatry South; I've been a PT for years now. No, it is not always the easiest place to get someone on the phone, but I would assume that they receive several hundred calls per day, and as someone who is a Surgical Scrub Nurse and Surgery Scheduler (on a longgg hiatus) it's just par for the course unfortunately. Right now, ESPECIALLY, we are ALL going through something in some way, and we've been doing it for almost a year now, so maybe try to give a little more slackthese guys attle bit of slack and a chance to make things right, ya know? Don't be afraid to come and leave a comment under your real name because it seems like the person that is answering the reviews (which says it's the owner or operator) REALLY DOES want to hear your concerns and wants to work on those. Therefore, I would encourage you to call them or go in and ask to speak to the administration if you have an issue before completely panning them on the Internet... although I DO understand we're all different so you're never going to make everyone happy. But the old saying of you get more flies with honey than with vinegar is quite true. I hope whoever reads this is having a great day and I'll send you all an early HAPPY HOLIDAYS!🕯️

name: island nora
text: This facility is a joke.  Anyone who may be experiencing anxiety of any kind would have a full blown anxiety attack just trying to get a human to answer the phone.  The constant “click 1 for this or 2 for that” is absolutely infuriating.  Not to mention, once you do leave a message it’s very much “up in the air” if you’ll actually get someone to call you back.  I would NEVER EVER EVER recommend such a horrible clinic.  Anxiety is real and reaching out for help is hard and this place just made the anxiety worse!!! It was a horrible experience and if you have an opportunity to go elsewhere, I would definitely do so to save whatever sanity you have left.

resp.text: I apologize you feel this way. We do have a “phone tree” of options, as do most all doctors offices. Especially those with 10 providers. It’s not a reasonable expectation that all calls be answered “live” from all patients when our office receives, on average approximately 200-300+ calls per day.  Although I’m sure that is ideal, in our specialty and in the field of medicine it is not a reasonable expectation. Our messaging system does tell you when to expect a response if in fact you do have to leave a message as well as a host of other information including how to reach someone if you deem your matter to be urgent. Although we are in abbreviated operations, our reception staff answers the phones during all business hours for scheduling purposes And urgent matters. If you called our nurses line and left a message for your provider that message is put into our medical record system and routed to the provider and he or she responds when they do not have patients to see at the current time. Additionally we give every patient the advanced opportunity of utilizing our patient portal whereby you can readily access parts of your medical record and send and receive messages from our office. If you were unhappy with an experience you had, its best to reach out to our management rather than leaving a blind review under a newly created account where it’s not identifiable.  We certainly ask for patience and grace during these unprecedented times. Again I encourage you to reach out to our management team to discuss any concern you have if it prompted you to leave such a review online. Thank you.

name: Simon Jones
text:
Fantastic facility that actually cares for their patients. If you’re looking for a pill pushing facility, this isn’t it.
If you’re looking for a pen to sign your disability forms or take you out of work because you don’t want to work, move along. They are doing real work there. Putting people in a position to function in their daily lives. The staff? These reviews are BS from people who want something for nothing or don’t get what they want. They are friendly and have always been easy to work with. I’m amazed at the people who would say otherwise and question the reality behind their reviews. Thank you Psychiatry South, you’ve given me my life back.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind reply. We are very appreciative.

name: Joshua Robertson
text:
I was a former patient a few years ago. I would pay for a one hour session, and be done in 20-30 minutes, not offered a refund for the time we didn’t utilize. I had many topics i wanted to discuss with my psychiatrist, but she only fixated on food and my eating habits. I felt guilty about the way i eat after several appointments. I would start to bring up a different topic that was mentally weighing down on me, and would be ignored and belittled for my dietary habits. Don’t go here if you want to improve your mental health.

In response to the reply to my original message above, yes, I DO have the correct practice. Psychiatry South, Inc. located on Valleydale Road. I was a patient in 2016. When I would speak to someone to set up an appointment, I was given two options: a 30 minute session and a one hour session. I would request an hour, because I feel like that is the time I needed to address my mental health. I was never prescribed or evaluated for medication. I think we briefly discussed depression and anxiety, but then it would get shut down, to then be berated for my dietary habits. When I would come in for an appointment, I would be out in 20-30 minutes after having paid for the full hour.

resp.text: I apologize this has been your experience with a provider. Perhaps you possibly have the wrong practice? Our psychiatrist’s follow-up appointments are scheduled every 20 minutes as they do mostly medication management with some supportive psychotherapy, while our therapists do therapy. Those sessions are 50-60 minutes at length and would cover such topics.  If this was a concern several years ago, as stated, and you were in fact our patient, we would have appreciated a chance to discuss it at the time. Thank you.

name: blue berry
text:
RUN, do not walk, from this place. I was not doing well when I tried to make an appointment and the woman I spoke with was horrible, nasty and downright cruel. The front desk staff should not be permitted to work with people seeking help with mental health. I have heard great things about the doctors themselves, but the people working the front desk are miserable and incompetent. I was treated so badly here. BTW, please don't reply "Blue berry, we do not have you in our records." Obviously my name isn't blue berry. After how you spoke to me on the phone, I don't want to risk you getting my real name and trying to call again.

EDIT: Since another reviewer wanted to say I shouldn't have used a fake name because the staff are nice...when I complained to them directly through email, they were cruel in response. I would not doubt for a second that she would do something vindictive if she knew who I was leaving the review. So don't tell me to use my real name - especially when you're not using yours. And no, this isn't "because of COVID" - this happened well before the pandemic - and as you surely agree based on all the 1 star reviews you've written in the last month, COVID isn't an excuse for abusive behavior from medical professionals.

name: Sweet Ralabama
text: The office staff/nurse department does not return phone calls, gives misinformation, and is quite frankly the most difficult medical facility I have ever had to deal with. Even when scheduling follow up visits, expect difficulties.

resp.text: We’re not able to identify you as a current patient or the accuracy of your profile. I apologize that has been your experience with a medical facility, however perhaps you have the wrong office. If you believe you do, please call our Administrator at 205-987-0724 opt. 6.

name: Kennedy Smith
text: It is very difficult to get an actual Provider on the phone. When you leave a message for a return call on their voicemail, you never receive a call back. To voice any concerns, you must wait for your actual visit. This is not a good process for building patient/provider relationships. Also, I can't speak to all providers at this practice, but it has been my experience that if you develop new symptoms or mental challenges, they are typically not addressed.

resp.text: I apologize that we haven’t met your expectations. Typically our provides aren’t able to take phone calls, like most other physicians, as they are seeing patients scheduled. We do have a nurse that relays all messages that are left for the providers. Our call volume is such that you would have to leave a message as it is impossible to get to every call. However the voicemail does tell you the expectations and  that the messages are checked and transcribed over to the physician. Once completed a call or portal message is made to you. Any patient, in any speciality of medicine, that is experiencing new symptoms needs an appointment so they can meet one on one with their doctor for assessment and treatment. I’m not sure if you even have the right clinic as I’m unable to confirm you as a patient,  but certainly wanted to reply from our standpoint. Thank you.

name: Parker Godwin
text: This is the WORST psychiatry establishment in the state of Alabama if not the entire United States. When you call their system it automatically puts you in contact with a voice message machine and takes them at the VERY least 24 hours for you to speak with an actual human being...... and thats if you’re lucky.

name: Zeke Bobo
text: The people at the front desk are rude and insensitive. The therapists are creeps. You, as a patient, are easily forgotten. I only stay because I fully trust and feel 100% comfortable with Dr. Sugg. The psychiatrists here are amazing. Everything else sucks.

name: Caryn Brown
text: I see Trey and he has been absolutely amazing.  My dr had me on drugs that were not supposed to be mixed. Trey caught it on first session. He took his time in getting the correct diagnosis and finding the best medication for me. He takes time and goes over everything with me. He is truly a great person.

resp.text: Thank YOU. We appreciate your kind review. It is our pleasure. We also think Trey is pretty amazing!

name: Ashley Wright
text: I love my doctor! This location is very easy to get to. The office staff has overall been nice and courteous. There has been a few appointments where I have had to wait over an hour but not many. I don't like that you have to pay for the doctors to fill out FMLA information. I haven't really ever had a problem getting an appointment. The only thing I don't like is when you leave a message for the doctor, the nurse practitioner returns her calls. She not very helpful in the slightest and normally takes a while to return your call. Other than that I have been very happy with them. They are 100 times better than the last psychiatrist I saw!!

resp.text:
Thank you for the review! We are always trying to improve our processes.
On paperwork, most offices do now charge for completion of the paperwork given the amount of staff and professional provider time it takes to complete them. We do, however try and keep our charges very minimal.
We do have a LPN that takes and processes all of our patients and clients calls out to our providers. We have a total of  10+ providers and  approximately 1300 active patients she does that for. When someone calls in, she takes the information left from the messages, transcribes it into the system and looks at the medical record to see what information would be helpful for the provider to make a recommendation on to the patient. Once the provider responds with the direction to give the patient she relays that.  Most of the time our nurse practitioners, physicians and sometimes, therapists, have limited time during the day between patients to return calls.
We are very appreciative to our patients who understand the processes and recognize we are striving to provide the best care possible to the most amount of patients who need it.
Thank you again!

name: Kim Herring
text: I hate to even give this place 1 star. The office is so disorganized and phone calls never returned. Ok with check in and wait time. However, past that you are a number with insurance and a co-pay. The doctor I WAS involved strictly asked a few simple questions and basically ask me what medicine I wanted to take...hello I am the patient not the doctor. Some of things they provide would surprise if any of the doctors knew how to spell them. I know they had to Google them to get the spelling and meaning. BEWARE.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. We apologize for your experience. I am not able to identify you as a current client/patient based on the information given. Perhaps you have the wrong clinic. Should you wish to discuss, please call our office at 205-987-0724.

name: Chip Casey
text: After my initial visit with the Dr., I was prescribed a antidepressant medicine that was new to me.  I developed insomnia as a side effect and went several days without sleep.  I called the office to ask for help and left message after message.  I finally had to stop the meds because I could not get a call back from a nurse or Dr.  The office staff is terribly rude and non responsive.   I ended up having to go to an ER to get help since this office could not manage to call me back.  I called 4 times over 4 days with no help!!!

name: liv gamble
text: I've never had a good experience here. I wait at least an hour every single time, the staff is rude, and they are clearly very unorganized.

name: Janice Ford-Freeman
text: Caring and compassionate physicians help me live my best life. Always running behind!

name: Charlee Burgess
text: Dr. Jones is amazing. Only doctor I've felt comfortable around. The staff is very nice - never had an issue - even when my appts were made with the incorrect doctor. i never have to wait long to see the doctor.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review.  We appreciate your kind words.  Please let us know how we can continue to serve you in the future! ~PSI Management

name: Kayla Guillot
text: I love this office! The receptionists have always been kind and helpful. I have had to wait for some appointments before to see my main doctor, Dr. Jones (not at the fault of her - hint: if other patients run late then your appointment gets pushed back too. It's not always the doctor or the staff's fault for your wait). I've never had to wait to see my therapist (Wilkes) and it is pretty easy to get an appointment with my therapist when needed. My doctor is harder to get scheduled with but it is only due to the amount of patients she has (which to me further proves she is a great doctor). Just for reference, I did see my therapist as close as once a week at one point and once a month for my doctor and I didn't have a problem finding an appointment to fit my schedule. Keep in mind as well, this is a large office with several doctors and therapists which accounts for the hundreds of patients they see and can lead to a wait time for documents which is normal. As a patient, it is important to have patience and be kind to the people (office staff) who you need help from. I would 100% recommend and have recommended this office to anyone who needs it! Keep up the good work ladies and gents!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind review! You insight is so valuable and I believe I speak for all of our physicians and staff when I say "THANK YOU."

name: Brandon Clements
text: This place is a joke. Been on same medication for 10 years. Had to pay for bloodwork for a new medication  and after three .months still haven't gotten the medication. This place will not refill a prescription without coming in for another appointment for medication that causes seizures if suddenly stopped. They don't realize people have to work. Never had these issues anywhere else. All they care about is your money not your well being.  Wouldn't recommend to my enemy.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. I understand your frustration, however we are under state, federal and insurance mandates to ensure we are seeing patients regularly who may be on a controlled medication and are monitoring per guidelines thus the order lab work. We cannot speak to the processes of other clinics, however we wish to maintain proper follow-up and quality care of our clients.

name: Dre Turner
text: The front desk receptionist is completely rude. Anytime I call their office she immediately puts me on hold without acknowledging me. What's the point in setting an appointment when you have to wait so long!

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. We apologize for your experience. I am not able to identify you as a current client/patient based on the information given. Perhaps you have the wrong clinic. Should you wish to discuss, please call our office at 205-987-0724.

name: Brighlyn Rowland
text: I have been trying since April to be seen by someone. I finally get my information sent to them and they never called back. I waited a week and called again and was told to call back if I didn’t hear anything. So I called again the next day and had to leave a voicemail. I was never called back. I called again the day after that and still no answer. It’s a really good thing I haven’t been out of medicine for almost 2 months now. The people here need to be better at scheduling, I have seen reviews where the same as happened to other people, so I know I’m not the only one. The lack of competency is putting people at risk. This is psychological problems that are being left untreated due to the inability to get anybody scheduled.

name: Babs Treadway
text: I called four days ago to schedule an initial appointment and am still waiting for them to verify insurance to schedule an appointment. Called a second time and still no reply. Office is very disorganized. The office response is an absolute lie. I was not offered an appointment. I called back and told you not to bother confirming insurance. I asked to speak to a manager and was left on hold. Office staff is rude and responds with a lie?!

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. I reviewed your complaint. I apologize for your experience. It does appear you called to request an appointment on the afternoon of 01/29/2020 (last Wednesday),  your info was able to be confirmed the afternoon of 01/30/2020 (Thursday), we are not able to schedule new patients on Friday as we operate with limited hours, and you were contacted this morning 02/03/2020 to discuss your options for scheduling and offered an appointment which was declined. I understand you called 4 days ago, however we have only had your information in que for verification/processing less than 2 business days. I hope you find this information informative. We are happy to talk about scheduling as discussed this morning.

name: Hunter Dennis
text:
Tried to charge a reschedule fee because the doctor was an hour late, and I had to go to work. So I left. Went back and forth with them forever to no end.

Reception has been absolutely horrible the entire time with communication and scheduling.

name: shannon moore
text: 1-3 hour wait EVERYTIME, ALL staff are extremely rude. This place is run on fear and intimidation, its an interrogation and negative vibes every single time. And you are trying to help people with mental issues?? WORST PRACTICE I HAVE EVER BEEN TO IN MY LIFE.

resp.text: You may have the wrong practice since we aren’t able to identify you. If you are our patient we’d be happy to discuss your concerns. This was left on Sunday afternoon, so we’re not open for normal hours, but we’d be happy to make contact with you on Monday. The administrator can be reached at 205-987-0724. Thank you.

name: Sara Bryan
text:
I have been going to see Dr Cassidy for 2 years. She left but I decided to stay. Had my 3 month appointment today to see the new doctor and they told me I needed a referral or it would be a $200 out of pocket payment. I had a referral. I drove an hour for them to turn me away. Front desk was less than helpful telling me to call my GP and my insurance should've informed me that I needed a referral. Why do I need to call about something I wasn't even told I needed and how would an insurance company know when I had an appointment? Ran my card as she was telling me all of this. I've never had any issues with these guys before but it is unbelievably bad business to let someone drive so far and treat them this way.

Update 10/19 I love how these people in "management" never called me back about refunding what they charged me and didn't leave a response ON GOOGLE until 2 days ago. This place is a joke. They do not care about their patients or how they handle business at all! Several other places in Birmingham to go to. Don't waste your time...

resp.text: I apologize for your experience.  Each insurance company and even plans within the payor differ.  We do try and inform the patients prior to care of their responsibilities of receiving the referral since we do not want the patient to incur balances that we, again, are contractually obligated to collect.

name: Daniel Hawkins
text: This place cares about nothing but your money. Avoid at ALL costs.

name: Anna Wade
text: They would reschedule my appointment and I wouldn't find out until I got there. The person I saw gave me my medicine but never actually listened to a thing I said. I felt like I was just a co pay.

resp.text: Perhaps you have the wrong clinic? We cannot identify a client/patient by the name presented here as a current client/patient. You are welcome to call our office to discuss at 205-987-0724. Thank you.

name: Jeremy Bullock
text: Love Dr. Suggs and his team. I've had to wait excessively once (on my initial visit) but the front desk attendant apologized and told me when I arrived that the day was moving behind. Dr. Suggs has followed through with everything he has promised and is helping me tremendously.

resp.text: Thank you very much for your kind review. We try to limit the wait times as much as possible. Our physicians are wonderful to take the time needed for each patient, so we are not always on time, but we certainly try. Thank again!

name: Andrew H
text: First of all, to charge someone $25 to prior approve a medication that the Dr. decided to prescribe is a joke and then they take their on sweet time to do it. Me and my wife both called and left messages for 4 days with no return call or prior approval. So I ended up calling the front desk to get this accomplished but had no problem taking the $25. I really do question the competency at this clinic. And yes I would be glad to discuss this with the management there.

name: Londarius Jackson
text: The staff is unprofessional, if you're looking for a Doctor office that cares this is not the place. There is no transparency in terms of billing. Trust me don't be hoodwinked. Trust me when I say take your business somewhere else.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. Im not sure what your entirely mean in your review. If you wish to speak with our office, the number is 205-987-0724.

name: Jack N. Guyton
text:
Dr. Austin,
I must apologize because I am not able to meet with you today. I am not feeling safe even though I have not given you an adequate chance at showing me what I have read is not true.
I only needed a brief appointment with a psychiatrist to get a referral for me to see a psychologist that I have worked with for many years in the past.

Due to the current things I have read I don’t get the feeling it would be a win - win situation for both your practice or myself. I have been abused by psychiatrist who made several incorrect diagnosis’s. The way things appear do not help my confidence or security.

I was only looking for instructions on how to find your office prior to leaving this in the morning when I was horrified with what all I have read. With all that is written I feel I should have had some warning about the accounts I may have read. I feel more information from your office would have offset the current situation. Thus, I can not be content do not want to waste your time and finances or my own as well. I hope you understand.
You have my sincere apology.
Good day,

name: Clay Earnest
text: Ive tried to get an appointment twice this week.  i have provided my insurance twice over the phone and never received a call back for scheduling.  Something is going on in that office.  I wouldnt go there

resp.text: We apologize you feel this way. I have researched and I would like to note that when verifying benefits on insurance, we are at the mercy of the companies handling those benefits to respond promptly to the requests. Please check your voicemail for information from 4/9/2019 giving you a status and also today, 4/15/2019 following up. We would like to assist if you will call us back. Thank you in advance.

name: Mary Vines
text: As this was my first visit, I was not impressed by the help out front. They talked down to you if you forgot to initial a line. Other than that, which I can, live with, the person that I was assigned to was extremely helpful. As I was called in, I felt comfortable instantly. Brittany was very understanding and listened  well to everything I had to say. I finally found someone to talk to that understood me.  We accomplished a lot for just 1 visit and I am looking forward to seeing her again and again.

resp.text:
Ms. Vines-

Thank you for review. We sincerely appreciate it.

I'm sorry to hear you had some initial issue with the personnel/paperwork.  We do strive to provide the best customer care possible.

If we can do anything for you in the future, please contact us at (205) 987-0724.

Thank you.

name: taylor smith
text: Receptionists are incompetent and extremely rude, appointments are never scheduled correctly in correspondence to patient medication refills, avoid this clinic at all costs.

resp.text: I apologize you feel this has been your experience. Our team does schedule based on follow up orders and give time for possibilities of reschedules when necessary, by scheduling earlier when possible. However failures to show for appointment, login in for telemedicine appointments or requests to reschedule do in fact throw those timelines off, to which when it’s done by the patient we have no control.

name: JasonTAK43
text: Dr lazenby is great dr. I was fortunate enough to see her at medplex. She treated me for substance abuse and depression and anxiety. She really took time with me and went out of her way to help me every way she could. I want to know if it's possible for me to see her to continue my psyche medications cause I really enjoyed bring her patient. She is one in a million.

name: Thanos
text: After wiping out half the universe and killing my favorite daughter Gamora I fell into a deep depression. I didn’t know what to do with myself but then... I found psychiatry south and Therapist Wes Wilkes helped me get through my depression and realize what I did was wrong. This place is great!!!

name: josh wright
text: Never had any issues with the staff or the doctors. Dr Austin is great! The only issue I had was that they charged 1400 for a drug test that was sent to some random hospital in Georgia. Had to pay 300 out of pocket with no prior communication about said cost

resp.text: Thank you for your review! ~PSI Management

name: Monica
text:
If I could leave this place 0 stars I would. Not only was I supposed to be scheduled to see a therapist, not a nurse practitioner, my appt was for 10:30am.  We were in the building by 10:05, paperwork was completely finished by 20 minutes after 10. 11:10 rolls around, still nothing.  I walked to the front desk twice, curious as to how.much longer the wait would be
The lady at the front desk should do a self check on her attitude, especially given her place of employment.  Perhaps, a job where you don't have to deal with people would be ideal.  This was supposed to my first appointment with them, and I decided to decline all future services with them based off of professionalism, attitude and all around disrespect to your potential patients.  I would highly suggest finding another office for your physch needs, all of the negative reviews seem very justified.

name: Lauress Kearse
text: Never been here. I drive an hour away to see my doctor. I asked him to refer someone close to me and he gave me this facility name. I'm going to check the reviews on the location in Hoover and if it is as bad as this place, I will be glad to continue to drive to Tuscaloosa. I like my doctor and I never wait more than an hour. Thanks for the heads up. I pay cash for my visits. The last thing I want to deal with is a doctor or staff that is rude and insensitive. If all these reviews are true,  you guys need to do better. Someone recommended my doctor and I recommended a few to him as well. I would never recommend this place. Wow…

name: Libby
text: Don’t waste your time here. I’ve been treated for a specific illness for years, came here when I moved and I was told I was “too young” for anything other than depression. They gave me meds that made me feel awful and won’t answer my calls about scheduling an appointment to fix it. If you’re looking for mental healthcare, Psychiatry South will worsen your mental health. **EDIT** In response to the "response from the owner" below - I did not try to call them at "almost 10:30" on a Saturday. I called on a Tuesday morning. I'm not so stupid that I would expect them to answer a call from 10:30 pm on a Saturday. This proves that this place is even more of a JOKE than I thought it was.

resp.text: I apologize you feel this way. Since it’s Saturday night at almost 10:30p our office wouldn’t be open to handle routine business matters like scheduling an appointment. We can verify appointment history, however our policy is to routinely see patients in regular intervals when medications are started. We will be happy to address it Monday morning when we reopen if you need to schedule/reschedule and appointment. If you’re in crisis, we do in fact have on-call personnel for such.

name: Sarah Beutjer
text: Please do yourself a favor and save yourself some time and a lot of stress! The wait times are absurd, the staff is absolutely the rudest staff at a doctors office I’ve ever dealt with and they never answer the phone! I was paying double the copy that I was supposed to be paying and they refuse to give me a credit for the extra they received and they say I owe money that I don’t! Trust me run, run the other way as fast as possible! There is not one good thing I can say about Psychiatry South.They have an F with the BBB! Do any research and there is nothing but bad reviews everywhere! From what I’ve read and seen first hand lots of signs of insurance fraud! I have no idea how this place is still in business!

resp.text: I apologize you feel this way.  We try and provide as much as information we can to you and hope that you received that from not only our office, but your insurance payor.

name: Kacie Reeves
text: I have been going to this office for little over a year. At first it was great and they really made you think that you are welcomed and special, but the more I go the less I feel that way. They NEVER answer thei phone, they rush you off the phone when they do, and it gives me severe anxiety when they won't answer the phone to confirm anything and that's what I'm being seen about! It's gotten awful and I am going to start looking for another provider and see if I can find that atmosphere I had when I first started here

name: Gwyneth Morales
text: Helpful staff, wonderful office. This is the first time in 13 years that I've felt comfortable with the people providing my care. I highly recommend this office!

resp.text:
Ms. Morales-

THANK YOU SO VERY MUCH for your kind words!  We always strive for the best service as possible.

Sincerely-

PSI Management

name: Joshua Smith
text: Dr. Sugg insisted on changing the course of my medication, even after receiving my history from a previous provider showing YEARS of consistently effective treatment. Additionally, he failed to electronically submit a 2 week prescription to get me through until I found a more reasonable provider, which has left me without crucial medication until then. Having just moved to the Birmingham area, I cannot think of a more counterproductive circumstance than having gone with Dr. Sugg as my initial mental health caregiver.

resp.text: Its unfortunate you feel this way.  Our physicians make the best medical decision for each patient given their history, presenting factors and consider all other relevant facts that could impact positive treatment outcomes.

name: Luis Perez Flores
text: I never had issues with this place I been seeing them for almost a year and only one time I had to wait over 1 hr. But Dr. Shug apologized and we took care of business as usual. If you don't want to be treated like an addict don't act like one, I walk in we talk about my mental issue  and I told him what I was taking and what I feel it was working and what wasn't I told him you are the doctor so you tell me what would help me. Since then I feel great

name: Patrick Michael
text: I strongly urge everyone to avoid this group. Most of the practitioners only work a couple of days per week. If you are having a serious issue that is not life-threatening, it may be weeks before your provider or designee responds. I've been a patient in this group for a few years now and feel that I must make a change. I even contacted the office manager regarding my concerns and no one has returned my phone call after 10 days. One other thing, this office has caused several traumatic events in my life due to their negligence. The following is the most impactful example: I was in an intense academic program at a local university. I needed documentation from my physicians to implement a 504 plan. I gave information to my provider the first time--the  504 office didn't receive it. The second time, I literally hand-delivered the documents to the office with a note describing the urgency of my situation. Finally, the 504 office had to contact my provider on my behalf to get the needed information. I have multiple health issues that require vigilance on my behalf to manage. The 504 office could not act on any of my disabilities until all documentation was in place. Because of this, I was unable to do what was required for the program. The day I had my 504 hearing to put my plan in place, I had just left a meeting with the program director informing me that I was being dismissed from the program because of my poor performance in the clinical setting.

resp.text:
Mr. Michael-

I am very sorry to hear of your experience.  This is not the practice of Psychiatry South.

I would like to the opportunity to address your concerns.  Please feel free to contact our office at (205) 987-0724.

Thank you in advance for your time.

name: Carlyle Galloway
text: The psychiatrist Dr. Sug is consistently an hour late for appointments, the office staff is horrible and never answers the phone or returns calls. Stay away. Don't give this place business.

name: Lindsay Wise
text:
If I could rate negative or zero stars I would!

I’ve been a patient here for years. I used to see Dr. Sung and she was amazing. When she left the practice, I was given no choice as to who my new doctor would be. In fact, I wasn’t made aware of her leaving until I show up for an appointment and they inform me that she is gone and I will now be seeing Dr. Sugg. Since that day, every visit has been TERRIBLE.

Dr. Sugg is always late. As in, I wait in the waiting room for at LEAST an hour PAST my appointment time before he calls me back. This happens EVERY TIME. I’ve asked to speak to the office manager multiple times only to be told that, “I’m next in line.”

I requested to switch to a different doctor (one that can see patients timely) and my request was denied for the reason, “they don’t see each other’s patients.”

Also, the other reviews stating that all Dr. Sugg does is type into the computer are completely accurate. I do not feel as though he listens to my concerns or even cares to be frank.

As I sit here typing this in the waiting room, it’s 1 hour and 15 min past my appointment time. This will be my last visit. I would NOT recommend this practice to anyone!

resp.text: I apologize for your experience.  Wait times can vary in our practice as what is needed by each patient is different.  Our physicians dedicate the time needed to address each person's particular circumstances or needs.  Unknowingly, at times, that can take longer than scheduled for. Our physicians dedicate their time and resources to their patients as their needs arise.

name: Casey C.
text:
My appointment was cancelled and I missed the initial call from Psychiatry South to reschedule.  I immediately called back to reschedule with no luck.  I have been trying to reschedule for 3 weeks now with no luck.  I've been hung up on several times and the recording at the beginning of the call warns leaving multiple voice mails delays the response time.  I have not received a response from the first voice mail I left three weeks ago so I tried it again today.  Fingers crossed!
You are dealing with mental health so I would think you would have a sense of urgency.  I have time sensitive meds that I have to have check up visits to recieve.
One more thing, all of the reviews on here are all similar complaints.  Do you not think it is time to reevaluate you admin procedures, staff, process, etc?  I love my doctor so I was always willing to wait 30 min to an hour to be called back for my quarterly visit, but I think it is time to find another just because of the front of the office.

name: Bailey Johnson
text: I could already tell I would have a terrible experience with this place just by reading t's other reviews. I will not be returning here ever again. Very rude staff. I have some anxiety issues so being stuck in a small room for more than 30 minutes while some rude lady was smacking her gum loud was enough for me.

name: User Name
text: New Patient within just hours now. They did not call in a prescription, will not answer the phone when you try to call busy I get but ,hire better staff that deals with customer calls hey take a sticky note duhhhh???. voice mail, call back, FORGET ABOUT IT. AVOID THIS LOCATION LIKE THE PLAGUE.  No customer service whatsoever!!!!

name: Cody Slovensky
text: As a patient of Dr. Anderson, I am very pleased with my service. He is very professional, the office staff is great and the environment is nice. Highly recommend this office.

resp.text: Thank you so much Cody. We really appreciate your review! If there is anything I, or the office, can be of assistance with, please let us know.

name: Dillon Quinn
text: The office staff is completely inconsiderate and down right rude. Unable to accomplish simple task and the patient care is poor. I wouldn't recommend this clinic

name: Gabrielle Quarles
text: So far my experience have been piss poor. Three appointments and I still haven't been seen by anyone. I got off work from working 630p-7a, yes a 12 hour shift, to come here and because I was told that if I came in early I will be seen early. Not the case. I get there at around 745 and was told by the "manager" that my appointment will start at around 9. When I tell her I have an interview at 10 she said the only option is to reschedule. I was misinformed and wasted time and gas just to be turned around. I called back wanting to speak with a manager and was placed on hold for around 12 minutes and was told she'll leave a message. I left another facility and was referred by my PCP to go to yall and so far i am upset. So I work another 12 hour shift tonight and have to do the same thing tomorrow and I am afraid I will be turned around again. I have no medicine now. IDK, maybe I am way in my feelings about this but when you drove across town just to be turned around, it's upsetting.

name: Annamarie Wallace
text: I feel that they are mean and do not care about patients well-being. They mostly deal with court referral patients and treat all their patients as criminals and/or drug addicts. This place does not feel welcoming and I feel as though anything I said was ignored and irrelevant to them.

name: Kenneth S
text: I have been a patient here for almost 4 years and have had nothing but the best treatment.  My calls are returned promptly and the staff is ever so accommodating at scheduling appointments  when I need to be seen earlier than my original appointment.

name: Patchy the Pirate
text: Arghhhhh Dr Sugg is a great matey!

name: Katia Kolbin
text:
I can’t even give one star. I am writing this, as I just found out I’m pregnant and sick and called for an appt yesterday. I love my doctor, and it’s the only reason I’ve been tolerating this place, but today is the day I have to go somewhere else. I can’t even tell you how unorganized this place is, the staff is rude. Writing this review, as I’m sitting to see my doctor and they just told me they do not have an appointment for me. This was the final straw. Please, please, please... listen to these reviews, they don’t lie! I don’t know how this place is still in business!

PS. I have never waited less than an hour, sometim s two at this place. In fact, every time I see my doc, I block a 3 hour wondow.

Update: they tried to argue with me. Yep, that happens. I have never missed an appt, I am an organized person. They told me they had a cancellation for 2:50. It’s 3:45, and I’m still waiting to see the Doc. Run!!!

name: Crystal Brophy
text:
Great doctors and staff, but they are very confused over appointments and insurance. I have corrected them several times that they are billing the wrong insurance and they still haven't fixed the issue after the efforts I have made to explain to them how they are billing the wrong insurance company.

Also, every appointment I've had with my psychiatrist had been rescheduled. Today they called me to reschedule tomorrow's appointment (so short notice) I've already taken off work tomorrow to go, plus I am out of Meds. I wish they would have let me know a lot sooner than the day before.

name: Austin
text: The office staff is tolerable, and the Doctor was terrible.  Dr. Suggs is an awful Doctor, who I unfortunately have seen before at the Alabama Psychiatric Building.  He will NOT work with you. He will NOT give you any options.  He doesn't listen to anything that you have to say, rather he hears it, and does not respond AT ALL.  I have seen many doctors, and prefer any of them, over him.  Please, do yourself a favor and find different psychiatric services.  I shouldn't have ignored Psychiatry South's terrible ratings, and neither should anyone else. I truly have never been so insulted; and would hate for anyone to be talked down to, like I was.  Truly a shame.

resp.text:
Mr. Adams-

Its terribly disappointing to hear of your concerns with Psychiatry South, or Dr. Sugg.

We truly do try and provide the best customer service as possible.

I would be happy to talk to you about your experience, should you so wish.  Our contact number is (205) 987-0724.

Thank you for your time.

name: Alisha Lowery
text: While my psychiatrist, Dr. Austin, is absolutely wonderful, the staff at Psychiatry South are very unprofessional. I have been calling since my appointment 2 months ago to check on a bill and pay it. Each time I'm told I have to leave a message for billing and have them call me. I do and noone returns my call. This happened before and when I got to my appointment I was told I had a bill. I explained that I had tried to call on may occassions and left many messages. I was told they tried to return my call but they did not. I know this for a fact. I just want to pay a damn bill and can't. You would think they would want their patients to do that but apparently they don't. The front office staff needs a refresher course on how to run the front office and the billing office needs to understand that they need to help people who are willing to pay their bills. I will be discussing this at my next appointment with Dr. Austin. This is so unprofessional and aggrevating.

name: Alex Fuller Cleveland
text:
EDITED WITH AN UPDATE:
My initial experience here was wonderful. In a matter of a few months, we had a perfect treatment plan in place. For some reason, though, they later became completely incapable of communicating. You have to harass them with messages for weeks just to get a response. In December, I turned 26 and lost my insurance. Dr. Austin assured me that this wouldn't stop me from getting what I needed. Every time I needed refills, it would take weeks of calls and me cutting my meds in half to make them last before she finally called them in, and after 4 months of that, she stopped calling them in at all and I was sent a letter saying that they were dropping me. I am still uninsured and cannot see a new doctor. Once I stopped being a walking dollar sign, my health and safety no longer mattered. I am deeply regretting recommending them to people as they've had equally terrible experiences, and I'm horrified at this lack of humanity. Shame on you.
Updates: the nurse finally called me after I escalated it to a couple angry voicemails. She told me that she would call in one last prescription as I don't have health insurance and cannot get a new doctor right now. She explained I'd have a 6month supply of all 3 of my meds. That was a lie, she called in 1 month of 1 of them, forcing me to stop taking the others suddenly.
Today I discovered that one of the drugs
I'm on interacts terribly with birth control, rendering both ineffective and causing seizures. My doctor never once mentioned this despite knowing what drugs I take. Glad I'm not pregnant or dead, guys, good looking out!
Don't go to these people. They don't care about you, only the money they stand to make from you, and that is incredibly clear.

name: Christina Diaz
text: I was a first time patient to see Dr. Anderson and I literally sat in the waiting room that day for 2 hours as I watched everyone that got there after me be called back. Besides that everyone was friendly and I enjoyed my Doctor, just think that the wait time should be adjusted for patients.

resp.text: Ms. Diaz- Thank you for your review and bringing this to my attention.  I sincerely apologize for your wait and will look into the time you waited.  I hope your next experience with us is much better. Thank you again.

name: Sl McK
text: I love Dr Lazenby and all the staff. Even when they have transitioned staff, someone always returns my calls. Dr Lazenby is the best. And the communication with the staff to get messages back and forth have been great. And I’ve nothing but praises for them dealing with all my insurance craziness. Dr Lazenby gives best quality of care, but also helps research the best medication that’s affordable for you that treats your symptoms.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review.

name: Heather McKinley
text: I have been looking for both a psychiatrist and a therapist for a long time.  This office is an answer to prayer.   I've had no problem with office staff and I've never waited more than 7 minutes. U got to remember most of the time is that if the dr is running behind its because another patient is having a particularly bad day.  I'm with Dr Anderson and Heath Who both have helped me tremendously in a few short weeks. Everyone giving bad reviews.... Just remember it could always be much worst.  My last psychiatrist just disappeared. Leaving 100's of patients with no where to get help.  Unfortunately the stigma of mental health issues may even be prevalent with the front office staff.  They should be retrained.  Most ppl are nervous going in and that can't help.

name: Kathey White
text: Dr. Austin is great but I would agree with the above that the office staff are horrible. I'm not sure the doctors are aware of all that goes on up front, because you can't get past the "gate keeper". She would get 5 stars from me but the office staff deserves far less.

name: Chris A
text: Never had any problems out of psychiatry south. I have been seeing them for years.

resp.text:
Thank you! We sincerely appreciate the compliment.  While we cannot always please everyone, in every way, due to many changes in healthcare and policies, we do indeed strive to provide the best level of care and customer service that we can.

Thank you again-

PSI Management

name: Maggie Braden
text:
It is very unfortunate that Dr. Anderson works at this particular practice as his review as a doctor is 5 stars but the office staff is highly incompetent and practices horrific customer service, which is putting it mildly.  I have been waiting for a response for over a week now on prior approval for my medication due to a new insurance carrier.  My pharmacy has faxed over the information 4 different times now along with calling and leaving messages with no response.  I myself have called multiple times and left messages for Kelly, the clinical specialist, and also with reception.  I have received one phone call back from reception who just sent me back through to Kelly who of course did not pick up the phone.
I am currently trying to reach them as well through sheer persistence.  My phone call has been answered once and as I was explaining my issue, I was cut off midsentence.  I then asked if I needed to just speak with Dr. Anderson directly.  This was apparently too much information for this poor girl's brain to process as she then became confused as to which person I needed to speak with & began to argue with me about Dr. Anderson not having listened to his messages, blah blah blah.  I was cut off again as I was explaining to her the person I actually needed was Kelly and was only requesting Dr. Anderson so that I might be able to get something accomplished.  Sent back to good ole Kelly's voicemail, I hung up as leaving a message is apparently pointless.  I have since been calling back incessantly, hearing the same hold messages over and over again.  At one point, someone picked up and actually hung up on me clear as day.

You people run an extremely unprofessional business, especially seeing as how this seems to be a recurring theme which obviously has not been adequately addressed.  Not treating your patients with respect and letting them run out of medication that a MEDICAL DOCTOR has prescribed to them is astounding not to mention highly dangerous.  I would say it's pretty audacious for office staff members to have the kind of ego that allows them to think they possess even one iota of medical knowledge allowing them to in essence dictate when patients may get their medication. I've never experienced such in my entire life and I would imagine this kind of behavior would be embarrassing to whoever owns this establishment.

name: Ann Moore
text:
This is the most on-time, organized, competent and caring physician groups I’ve ever used. I’ve been using them for years moving to this location from their old location. If someone had a bad experience there must have been misunderstanding. I’ve never seen anything incompetent or uncaring about this staff!
