****I have to update my review. I’m very sorry to do this as Dr Jones is an excellent physician. But the staff, specifically Kelly is making me lose my doctor. I understand more than many, about COVID changing rules, etc but the treatment by Kelly (and who knows how many others), have made me afraid of this practice. I have had a telemed appt cancelled because when I was trying to tell them I was running late to park, I spoke with staff over a 5 minute deadline. Then I have attempted to use telemed app and passwords are often changed by PSI. The app is horrible as we had too many issues and had to use an insecure line. I didn’t mind that but having to leave messages which were not returned and previous visits were monthly and last appt suddenly changed to almost 3 months away and was ignored. My symptoms are worse and I cannot talk to dr Jones. If she knew this was going on, I would hope that Kelly would be fired.  There are too many issues to further convey. But I hope Dr Jones calls me before I find someone else. Today is 9/25/2020.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review.  We truly appreciate it.

name: Kathie J Jones
text: I have had awesome care by Dr Rebecca Jones, as well as Suzette Smalley, counselor.

resp.text: Thank you again for your kind review!

name: Emmanuel Tynes
text: Wait is too long. No one returns phone calls. Everyone acts like their clients are an inconvenience.

resp.text: I apologize you feel that way. If you are our client/patient, feel free to call and speak with management. If you aren’t a client/patient with our clinic, I’d kindly ask you to remove your review.

name: Zach Edwards
text: First off I have never dealt with such incompetent people in my life. The office staff is the rudest and most disrespectful group of people I've ever meet. They will not return phone calls to the patient or to the pharmacy about medications or any other reason. If you need a prior authorization for your insurance plan on waiting atleast three weeks to a month for them to file it and that's only after you've payed their $25.00 processing fee and that's for each p.a. If you call and cancel an appointment they will still charge you $75 if they forgot to take you off the schedule because of an office mistake.

name: Cheyanne “Absentasia” Maree
text: The Doctor was nice, but the administrative staff is absolutely terrible. Worst I have ever seen. They made an appointment for me without consulting me, and then did not notify me of said appointment, and then because I did not show up to the appointment I did not know about, they decided to drop me as a patient because I was "non-compliant". Trying to fix the issue is just an absolute headache. I would not recommend Psychiatry South to anyone, and would go as far as to tell others to avoid it like the plague.

name: Sam Paxton
text:
UPDATE: After almost 90 days of trying to reach this office: Emails, phone calls, voicemails, and physically dropping off a letter to the office, I never received a phone call back. I have now received a letter saying I have been a non compliant patient and they are terminating me as a patient. PSYCHIATRY SOUTH is unprofessional and does not care about their patients.

#1: $500 for an appointment and urinalysis. #2: It has been 40 days now I've been trying to get in touch with my doctor, a manager, WHOEVER can help. I'm not calling to make an appointment, I'm calling with a concern and can't get any resolution. I have even physically gone up to the office and was brushed off. I have now had to come off my medication cold turkey because the staff won't return my MANY calls and voicemails. This is extremely dangerous with the medication I'm on. Additonally, the staff has NO CLUE about private pay (no insurance) fees. I got a bill in the mail 3 months after my appointment, and I paid OUT OF POCKET. My charges shouldn't be a mystery, they aren't even filing insurance. Don't waste your time and money here.

name: Cj Sands
text: I have had anxiety all of my life and about 6 months ago, they developed into the form of panic attacks. When I have them I feel as if I can't breath and am going to die and they are happening on a daily basis. I have explained to dr sugg my history and my need for something until I can get on with daily life and be able to breath again. He has been very difficult and rude to me. He told me that he thinks I would be fine with just therapy, which I have tried, and told me he had other patients to see and I needed to leave as I was crying. He told me the fact that I've seen 3 different doctors about my anxiety raises questions. I still have no help for my anxiety and no prescription and am only getting by by drinking "calm" drinks from target and taking "anxiety vitamins" these however do not save me from the terrifying panic attacks that I am suffering on a daily basis. It feels like I'm having a heart attack at least twice a day. Maybe my post will create more anxiety awareness as I hope his other patients aren't having to suffer through what I am going through.

resp.text: We apologize you do not feel as though your issues were addressed by our physician.  We extend you the opportunity to speak with our Administrator or clinical director if you feel your needs were not addressed.  Thank you in advance.

name: Emily Allen
text: Dr. Austin was wonderful. However, when a communication issue (not returning my calls) came up recently, I ended up running out of ALL of my medication. (VERY bad thing.) I had to go to the office in person to speak to someone. I didn't get a single apology, and instead of being treated as an adult with a valid complaint, I was talked down to and treated as a child who was misbehaving. I asked to be discharged so I could find another doctor, and two days ago received a letter stating that I had been "dismissed due to noncompliance." Over the top incompetence on their part. They were supposed to get me enough meds to last 30 days two weeks ago; haven't heard a word, even after the pharmacy faxed them on my behalf. Go to a place where the staff, not just the doctors, respect the patients.

name: Countess Fleming
text:
BBB rating is an F.  Possible FRAUDULENT billing practices.  BEWARE of this practice.  Office staff COMPLETELY UNPROFESSIONAL AND RUDE. I would never recommend this practice. Also, Dr. Lazenby and Dr. Austin will not return your phone calls.
Dr. Countess Fleming

name: Missy Meagan
text: Most unprofessional, crappiest staff I’ve ever seen.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. We apologize for your experience. I am not able to identify you as a current client/patient based on the information given. Perhaps you have the wrong clinic. Should you wish to discuss, please call our office at 205-987-0724.

name: Mary Hudgins
text: My Dr. Is wonderful But the office staff is the WORST I have ever seen.  I called for a refill on my prescription 6 or 7 time even telling them on the multiple voicemails I left that I could come in just to get a refill if they needed me too, I also left a message on THEIR webpage about this and NEVER got a call back, its been 4 weeks now! My primary the following Monday had to write a Rx for me after my pharmacy had to give me a emergency refill for 3 days.  I have multiple health problems including a heart condition which would have been made worst if I had suddenly stop my medication.  I was referred to this company by my wonderful Rheumatologist, who would have never referred me if he knew what would happen.  So I suggest if you need medication for ANY medical condition that this "company" would write for you DO NOT need to go here! Absolutely do not go here for any medication or if you might need emergency medical attention!

name: Matthew Wilson
text:
Seriously the worst place I have ever been to. I have been visiting this place for over a year now and taking the same medication for a year. Suddenly they cant refill my prescription because the "doctor" I saw no longer works there. So they suddenly cut my medication off completely,  and proceed ro tell me that i have to ckme in for an appointment to have my prescription refilled. I dont mind coming for an appointment, but you just called and cancelled an appointment we had scheduled for last month. Why would you refuse to refill? They could at least provide me enough of my daily medication to last until my next scheduled appointment, but no, they wont eveb do that. The staff is ignorant and could care less about anyone. When I ask to speak with someone from administration,  I constantly get forwarded to a voicemail in which the call is never returned.
I seriously believe being a crash test dummy would be more beneficial than trying to seek any kind of assistance from these idiots.
For those who have had the same or similar frustrations from these people, please join me in contacting the State and let's move forward from that point. Apparently these people believe mental health is a joke.

name: Lara B
text: Wanted to be a new patient there but they didn't even give me a chance! Took all my info and never called me back! I called them twice, she said they were working on checking my insurance info (really, all other places tell you straight ahead if they accept my insurance or not) !!!! Terrible!!!

resp.text: Unfortunately, that is not the case.  Most all other specialties are able to tell you up front if they accept the insurance type.  With Mental Health, the benefits can be carved out to several different payors and therefore could cost the patient a lot out of pocket; all of which we try to avoid.  I apologize for your experience.

name: Dana Elkins
text: If I could give anything below a one star I would!! Please do not waste your time with this facility. The office personell are incompetent. I gave the benefit of the doubt after reading these reviews...believe all of them!

name: T. Ferguson DiazBrothersFan
text:
Dr. Anderson was great! He just disappeared, gone! not given a chance to pick another doctor! I was thrown on to Dr sugg, no say! Dr. Sugg has little to no compassion.  He never has answers to questions. Rather he looks at his laptop pushing whatever on the screen!!!  I hope the owner has took notice of all the complaints regarding Dr. Sugg and does something about it *update they have & don't care! Having a doctrine degree gives you the title doctor but it does not make you a good doctor and it sure doesn't give you compassion. Amanda Miller is so right about everything she said and I have went through the same nightmare!!
UPDATE: I having stage 4 terminal cancer going through A LOT as a single mom...thank God I found another psychiatrist that cares! That recognizes PTSD. One that doesn't drug test you every single time, making you feel singled out like a junky, not every patient was drug tested every time!! *update again! E Campbell re your review 1st "your not sure why Dr sugg has many negative reviews? maybe because there's a problem with him and you don't get it because you & only 2 others like him out of over 70 reviews, your judgemental too like him" like ass-uming one is abusing their medication! I did NOT abuse my medication, even passed every pill count much less drug test repeatedly not that its your business. I referred to how he would test me monthly but not other patients, that is "singling one out" and if i was African American I would slap him with a discrimination lawsuit along with Psychiatry south who condones all the negative complaints of his behavior!! I asked him why he stayed on the laptop (i have no reason to make it up) and his reply "he must update my medical info" well my cancer is not for him to update that's for my oncologist! fyi I have stage 4 cancer and do not even take pain meds while you want to pass judgement, I see why you hit it off with him!  You need to stick to reviewing the doctor not judging other patients! I'd like to know why management brushes off the negative reviews only focusing on a positive one, probably shocked to see one! I mean when most reviews are negative among over 70, the common denominator is the doctor and or practice! I too asked to see another doctor in the practice, I know Dr. Austin is a wonderful caring doctor but no! i was told I would have to do an exit review with Dr. sugg to get such approval instead he pointed out my original google negative review on here and immediately began to cut my medication which is dangerous and clearly retaliation. I'm only on Wellbutrin and 2 benzo a day, my goodness, divorced single mom, ptsd and stage 4 cancer,  your anxiety/depression/ptsd would be bad too! Documenting is very important but not during the whole appointment never giving the patient attention and when given, uncaring and short with you! Also, a good psychiatrist documents in between patients but when the doctor is late that leaves him no time to do so which brings me to the time I came from Tuscaloosa all the way to Birmingham for him not to be there, however he did apologize when I had seen him at the next visit for no-one failing to notify me. I can appreciate that but it's a huge inconvenience after a bilateral mastectomy and 2 hour round trip! A doctor must find a balance between documenting and doctoring after all you are there to get help, to be listened too not to documented like you are in a court trial.. I get the DEA is hammering down but its pretty clear they are controlling many doctors to the point the patient does not matter only covering their as*! Well there are ones that can care for a patient and do it legally documenting keeping in DEA guidelines, balancing it out! Matter of fact when one documents to heavily you have to question why? As there's no reason to be concerned with overly documenting when you know you been ethical and management should agree, however they don't seem to care about ones who have been negatively affected only positive reviews.

name: Mary Samples-Hudgins
text: So I got a $75 bill from these people after I cancelled an appointment on 15th that was scheduled for the 18th. You apperantly cannot post pictures on Google review but if you would like to see my phone record I posted a comment to your Facebook page as well as sent a private message to you... I'm not going to call you again because it apperantly will not do any good.

name: Steve Martin
text: Staff not responsive to voicemail or answering phone to get appt scheduled. If your only a quarterly scheduled ie... not a high income patient your considered a C client. Sung will drop you off her patient list by scheduling you months away even if you need your prescription filled. I had to reschedule an appointment and was only given a time that was two months out, knowing my prescription had expired.

name: Preston
text: I'm a dentist, I know the challenges of scheduling and managing an office. The only word I have to describe this place: absolutely terrible.

resp.text: This is disappointing to read.  I would like to extend an opportunity to you to discuss any issues you may have had.

name: Lucy Schley
text: Staff refuses to return emails or phone messages, making it impossible to speak to anyone if you have a problem.  Very unprofessional staff.  I would not recommend this group to anyone.

name: Tammy Stringfellow
text: I saw Dr. Suggs APS and wasn't impressed with him. However I was pregnant and didn't need any medication from him. I told him I fully intended to go back on all my medication as soon as I had the baby. Even then he pushed the non-addictive mild medications for when I did go back on them. I ended up seeing another doctor after I had the baby and went back on all my normal meds without an issue. As of last month my doctor that had been prescribing me meds left her practice. She suggested Dr. Suggs and I'm not sure why but I agreed to see him. I was told to arrive at 9:40 which I did. I then filled out multiple pages of paperwork. After an hour or so I asked the somewhat rude receptionist what was taking so long. She said I still needed to do labs! Labs, seriously for what? I have NEVER had to do labs to see a psychiatrist but whatever. After labs I waited another 30-45mins. When I saw Dr.Suggs I explained how I had been having more anxiety than usual due to some personal issues. He then asked all about the personal issues only to give me NO options to up the dosage of my anxiety meds or he said I could quit taking one of the medicines I've been taking for over 10 years. He said that benzo's are habit forming and benzo's aren't meant to be used for long term use. I asked him why so many doctors had prescribed these for over 15yrs without hesitation. He just shrugged and said he didn't know. I should also mention that Dr. Suggs literally has the personality of a robot. I would've been better off going to a doc in the box. He seems to think that the medications that he likes for his patients to take is the right medication for every patient to take. I've taken almost every med you can think of. My opinion of what has worked and what hasn't worked should matter. Also, he questioned me so much on dates and RX's that were filled that I felt like he was accusing me of Doctor shopping. That isn't the case I've just had to see diff docs due to insurance or APS closing or etc! Anyway, I will NEVER set foot I that place again. Dr. Suggs needs to switch specialities bcse he sucks at compassion and he's just the kind of Doctor that makes you feel embarrassed you even went to the doctor!  DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME at this place!! Awful staff and even worse is Dr. Suggs the inconsiderate robot.

name: Amanda Carr
text: I've had nothing but trouble since I started coming to this practice.  The office staff is rude and waits forever to return calls, if you get a call back at all.  Not to mention having an appointment scheduled on the doctor's off day at the location - with no phone call ahead of time.  Talk about a wasted trip!   Save yourself the hassle and go somewhere else!

name: amanda miller
text: My experience with Dr. Sugg has been awful.  Aside from waiting for at least 45 minutes after the scheduled appointment time, he just sits there in his "office" typing on his little laptop IN HIS LAP because he doesn't even have a desk save an end table next to his chair.  He asks the same battery of questions every time that can be answered with one word responses.  I like to have good relationships with my medical providers.  That is impossible with this man.  He talks to me like I'm dumb.  The last time I saw him it was an emergency visit because I ran out of refills for my medication and when I tried to express my dissatisfaction for the communication breakdown between him and me, he blamed me!  At one point I was answering work related emails and texts while I sat in the chair waiting for him to finish typing whatever he was typing (which, by the way, I can't figure out what he could be putting in my chart since we don't talk at all) and he proceeded to sneer at me as though I was the one being rude.  REALLY?  He is a nightmare to work with and I dread every appointment I have with him.

name: Melissa
text: Dr. Sugg is wonderful. He has always been willing to listen to me and help me.

name: Hulk
text: HULK SMASH!!!!! HULK DOES NOT SMASH ANYMORE AFTER GETTING HELP FROM PSYCHIATRIST!!!

name: Woody
text: You’re my favorite deputy!

name: Andrew Elliott
text: Staff is very un-responsive. In general avoid this place it will make everything more complicated and more expensive than it should be. Just avoid.

resp.text: I apologize you feel this way.  We do not try to make anything more complicated, however we do have a duty to obtain the information we need for treatment.  Our pricing is based on care and contractual fee schedules and we do try and work with those without insurance.

name: Jeremy Thompson
text: The idiot in the office wanted me to cold turkey drop medication that causes serious side effects with no alternatives. he offered no alternatives to this he just said you must stop taking immediately. so I give this place a one only because I can't give it a negative one plus they're so lockdown they even make you pee in a cup so apparently at some point there were about to lose their license or something. so they've had to lock down with more paperwork and more drug testing. all that to say I had a very very very bad experience at this place

name: vandalyn green
text: I'm a new patient. I HEARD my so called doctor put patients ahead of my appointed time. I've been waiting over an hour. The dr is Anderson and I'm already having a negative outcome. NOT COOL!

name: Nathan Shugart
text: I highly recommend no one ever stepping foot in this place. Office staff is GARBAGE!

name: Spongebob Squarepants
text: I’M READY, I’M READY, FOR MY APPOINTMENT WITH TREY THE NURSE PRACTITIONER!!!

name: Joshua Blair
text: Don’t visit with Linsey she will schedule a bunch of appointments without consulting you.

resp.text: I apologize you feel this way.  Follow-up appointments are scheduled in office with the treating therapist and discussed with the patient, the patient is given a reminder card and an additional reminder call two days prior to the appointment.  We truly try to do everything we can to assist patients with following through with their appointments.

name: David Smith
text: Horrible!  If you didn't need a psychiatrist before dealing with these people you'll definitely need one afterward!!!

name: Paula Hutsler
text: This place is RUDE! Don’t go! They literally do not care about their patients .

name: Angelia Manley
text: The WORST patient care by far.  Lack of respect toward patients, terrible beside manner and office personnel rude and tactless.  If you're looking for a suicide mission, do yourself a favor and visit this office.  They'll give you every reason to want to blow your brains out!

name: Kai Mardis
text: I haven't been here yet; I might end up here due to my constant terroristic thoughts.

name: Katie S.
text: The WORST place!!! They never return your phone calls and don't care about the patient or their needs!! Especially Dr. Suggs!! The staff is a joke!!! Do not go here!!

name: Robert Persons
text: Worst staff ever. Very rude. Will not return calls.

name: Erik Thomas
text: Pathetic customer service. The first question was what type of insurance do you have? Now I see why the ratings are so bad on google.

name: Ashlyn McClearia
text: I DIDN'T SEE A DOCTOR PERSONALLY. I AM FROM A DOCTORS AND WE REFERRED A PATIENT.THE PATIENT WAS TREATED POORLY BY THIS OFFICE STAFF AND THE NP. THE STAFF WAS ALSO RUDE TO THE REFERRING DOCTOR'S OFFICE. NEEDLESS TO SAY, WE WILL NOT BE REFERRING TO THIS GROUP AGAIN.

resp.text:
Ms. Phantomhive-

That is disheartening to hear.  We maintain wonderful relationships with our referring clinicians.

Should you wish to discuss, please contact our office at (205) 987-024.

Thank you in advance.

name: Lucy S
text: Pending.. Before I complete this review I'm going to follow up with the office and see what they have to say about the critical errors they have made.

name: Pamela Flanagan
text: now I am a little worried....

name: Mocha S
text: Didn’t feel welcomed at all

name: jamie hester
text: Multiple times physicians have quit and my appointments have been canceled with no notice.   Multiple times I have been unable to reach someone or get a call returned regarding refills on medication and had to go without for days/weeks.  Multiple times my physician has been changed without notice.

name: Isaac Shepherd
text: Dr.Stephens seems like a great guy but I had one appointment and this place has called me and cancelled on me 3 separate times the day of or the day before and each time they postpone it weeks or a month down the road then when it comes around they call and cancel I would go elsewhere but this is the only place local I can find who will accept my insurance I feel so sorry for people who have worse problems than me and get these phone calls saying they can’t get help

name: Theresa McNamara
text: I visited this facility recently and have to say that I was treated extremely professionally;  courteously;  with consideration and kindness.  Their knowledge,  patience and tenacity of purpose demonstrated their desire to serve their community unflinchingly.  I assure the reader that this is a true reflection of my experience and simply reflects what I experienced.

name: Jinja Kween
text:
I first had a doctor that kept telling me that women are this and that and should take less medication than men. He made me feel very uncomfortable to the point that I requested a new psychiatrist. I then had a very sweet lady but she "quit" very abruptly so I believe she was fired because she was trying to help the patients more than a regular doctor would. She gave medication that you requested after a certain time of thinking it over.

Now I have a very bitchy therapist. Straight up just told me a lot of BS and that I had a lot of problems, which I'm very aware of, and tried to force me to talk about my past which due to my mental issues I can't actually voice. She took me off my clonopine without weaning me down. So we don't get along and she might even take more of my medications away from me.

Please do not go to Riverbend if you can avoid it. They will not help you. I don't know how many times I have requested more counseling and never received a call or appoint for. This place is hell.

name: Jason Kelley
text: I would recommend coming here my sister was to sad to do some stuff now she's going to Alabama and one of the funniest people I know

name: Neit Hodges
text: It needs updating as far as how to actually care for patients more effectively. They don't utilize all things. Their best approach is medication management. They also don't reach out to the community much or to their out patients who may like some activities such as dances and healthy meals. Also they allow smoking which quite off base if they are a health center. More counselors that may have a background as an "African American" cause it is difficult to relate to a counselor who is not from your background. Also the doctors lack other ways besides medication to aid the patient to a more stabilized life. And the inpatient or patient going to the day services gets met with the same dull classes day after day from mainly a mentor reading off of a printout or book. Many ways to improve but they don't. Because of possibly misfunding or underfunding. I wouldn't recommend this for long term at all.

name: Cassidy Cabrera
text: My parents took me here because I was depressed all the time I had an in school therapist from there and my insomnia was getting the best of me and they took care of me professionally and helped me with what I needed, they are extremely hard to get an appointment with though

name: scoobert doobert
text: Please do not go to this place for help. Every time I've gone, it's been complete embarassment. They make you dump all of your problems on them that are usually shameful, especially when you are in need of help, only to tell you cliche comforting words. Find a therapist, because this place is NOT that. Horror story, don't even wanna talk about it!!!

name: IsamuMayuri
text: Have been using their services for over a decade. Provides wonderful services for the community.

name: Billy Hanback
text: The absoult worst place I ever been. The Dr. Can't even take notes right. STAY AWAY....

name: Anonymous Anonymous
text: My therapist said I could go to the ER and get antidepressants and be on my way. I ended up spending 6 hours in a monitored room with no way of getting in touch with my family. I was ashamed and embarrassed. She lied to me and pushed me to look into religion. Not a fun place to go. I'd rather bottle everything up and not tell anyone anything than go there again.

name: Shawntay Pritchard
text: This place is slow as hell. My grandma had an appointment and been in the for hour and 45 minutes before she even was seen.  That is pitiful...

name: J F
text: Horrible.

name: Stephanie Gray White
text: A wonderful, caring staff

name: julian mazone
text: Horror story

name: Lauren Lochamy
text:
I was seeing Dr. Polek for several years before I finally had enough and decided to leave. The appointment that finally did me in, he was so condescending when we discussed my anxiety and depression. Like it was something I could control on my own. He didn't understand how I could STILL be having issues. After talking down to me, raising his voice, and bringing me to tears, Dr. Polek nonchalantly suggested i "just meditate, do yoga, go to therapy" he repeated this multiple times. All because HIS treatment plan had not been working for me. Then when it was time for me to leave the office, he asked if I would go in the back and "clean up" before I walked out in front where his other patients were sitting. He had no problem sending me off in tears but I better not make him look bad.
On a brighter note, Kristen, the receptionist up front is one of the kindest and most professional people I have ever met.
Even though it was a huge hassle for me, I ended up finding a new Dr. and I will never let anyone talk to me that way again.

name: OWEN BURNS
text:
STAY AWAY!!!
Highly recommend NEVER going to see Dr. Polek.  How someone can run a business the way he does and still have any patients is astounding.

name: Kathryn Larson
text: The stars are only for the very sweet, respectful secretaries the doctors have. The therapist, Hartline, seems to be a caring woman. But my main issue was dealing with my medication, which is Dr. Polek's side. I see why people think he is a med pusher. For having to drive 30 minutes, pay hundreds of dollars (initially before a payment is set according to insurance) and to get max 15 minutes with the doctor-no thank you. It was very easy to be written different forms of meds, without them knowing very much of my history. Now I appreciated him not pushing against my wishes, when it was made obvious I needed something. However, it felt odd for it to seem so easy. Which was not concerning for me, because I don't have problems with addiction-but for many others suffering with psychiatric issues it is.

name: Bryan Hill
text: I have been to several different Psychiatrist not just as a patient but also a caregiver. The staff and Dr are extremely nice and very helpful. They handle all prescriptions and new patient sign up electronically which is amazing. Must places I have seen still make you spend an hour or two to fill out all the paperwork in the office. The doctor does a great job explaining the possible care options and is really willing to work with you and make sure you have all the information you need. I highly recommend this place.

name: Diane Natale
text: I found it odd that this physician has to have your SS# before making an appointment. There is no reason that a Dr.'s office needs your SS# especially when you will be paying a co-pay or cash for your visits. I have never given my SS# to a Dr.'s or dentist office and never had a problem. The only reason they would need it is to do a credit check or to make it easier to track you down if you leave owing them a balance.

name: Glory Locs
text: They are racist and only see white people! They make you fill out new patient paperwork to see if you qualify! By sending in you License they then see that you are not white then they deny you as a patient!

text: This is LITERALLY the most amazing practice I have ever experienced. I was a patient at Grayson and Associates and hated feeling like I was being written a script and shoved out the door. At my first visit, he took the time to really discuss my issues and ask for my input in a treatment plan. He was very thorough and took the time to actually HEAR what I was saying/answer my questions.  I would recommend his office to anyone!

name: Morgan Fullerton-Schroeder
text: That doctor is a jerk. I visited the practice as a new patient, and the receptionist needed my drivers license. Two weeks later, it was a Saturday night and I was leaving for a cruise the next day and looked in my wallet to realize that the receptionist had forgotten to give me my license back. She never gave me a call or anything to tell me that she had it in her possession. Dr. Polek had given me his personal number on his business card for emergency use, so I called him to see if there was any possibility of getting my license before I left the next day or I wouldn't be able to get through customs. Before I could even explain my situation he cut me off, said I was bothering him, said to not call back, and then he hung up on me! I ended up driving to Montgomery just to get a replacement. An hour after I got my new license, the receptionist called me and said she found my original license buried behind a stack of papers BEHIND HER COMPUTER! Will NOT be going back

name: erin edwards
text: I wish I could give this clinic ZERO stars. Let's start with my journey with Dr. Lane- Psychologist- I spoke with Lane 2-3 times total in my time at Psychiatry 280. She was over 30 minutes late to TWO of my appointments (not because she was dealing with another client.) At the end of my last session with her, she STILL did not know my name or anything about me. After my 2nd visit, I met with Dr. Polek for approximately 15-20 minutes. I was unsure of him from the beginning based on what I walked away with versus what I explained my issues were. After testing multiple different treatments with him, I called 5 Psychiatrists in the Birmingham area, and my previous Psychiatrist in Auburn- most of them knew of Psychiatry 280 and the ones that did told me they had only heard negative things about Dr. Polek. Each and every one of them were appalled at the treatment I received. I take medication very seriously- they can do SERIOUS damage to your health and even be fatal if not properly researched or if combined with other medications. Luckily, I was not harmed. FINALLY, when I requested my medical records after telling them how upset I was with them- they denied me my personal records 4 different times, stating that it was illegal for them to give them to me because it was a "Psychiatry Clinic". I spoke with an attorney who told me what my rights were according to HIPAA and contacted them one last time to inform them that it was in fact ILLEGAL for them to deny me my Psychiatrist Medical Records. (HIPAA Code 45 CFR 164.501) I DO NOT recommend this clinic to anyone hoping to find a doctor that LISTENS to you. It's sad that we live in a world where we cannot trust our doctors. On a nice note, Kristen the receptionist was the most professional person in the building and very understanding throughout my whole situation. On top of that, I just got a call saying that I "owe" $99 and I haven't been in since June 2016. Funny how Lane can tell if money is missing, but can't remember my name!

name: Torey Lavish
text:
Worst professionalism I’ve ever dealt with as far as their front desk and receptionist go. Definitely not who you want to trust with your issues and problems. THEY DONT CARE!

Back story: First appointment, my fiances mother wanted to make sure I gave them the right insurance cards in order because she said they got misfiled in incorrect order last time and it took them over a year to fix so I told that to the receptionist when I got there and she snarkly responded "I doubt that". To which I responded... "No it wasn't a question "if" ...it did..". Then I was filling out the paperwork for my fiancé and she said that he needed to fill it out hisself . With his condition he can't do that so I told her that was the whole reason we were there in the first place, and that he couldn't. She was super rude and snarky and judgemental the whole time. So we had to leave to find him an appropriate writing utensil he would use and he finally signed the papers. Fast forward to this time:
He has a 2:00 appointment, we arrive at 1:40... we sit all the way til 2:30 thinking Dr. Schwartz was just running behind. Then he comes out at 2:30 and calls a different patient back... so I ask Dr. Schwartz when my fiancé's appointment time is to which he says he doesn't know, so I go to the desk and ask and she tells me it was at two... but that he was running behind.. but she neglected to mention any of this for the fifty minutes we waited. So then my fiancé asked how much longer it will be for him then, and she said thirty minutes.. so we decided to leave and go get coffee.. We come back in only twenty minutes and see the previous client leaving when we walk in. She came out the door and said " Dr. Schwartz came out after he finished with his client and you weren't here and I was "unsure" if you were coming back so I went ahead and gave him his next patient. To which I responded... No you told us it was thirty minutes til he would be seen.. so we left and came back in twenty. She just kept blaming it all on Dr. Schwartz when all of it was literally her lack of professionalism that caused this whole scene. She never told us he was running late, nor apologized. She never told Dr. Schwartz what she told us about him being able to see him in another thirty minutes... like I have never in my life witnessed such carelessness and unprofessional from a "professional" practice. So Dr. Schwartz didn't even end up seeing my fiancé even though we waited approximately an hour and a half. And he missed work to not even get his appointment due to the vendetta this receptionist had against him. Take your time and money elsewhere!
* She is the receptionist with box colored black hair btw. Don't even know her name.

Mr. Burchfield np was great! The treatment and attention/diagnosis understanding

text:
This outpatient clinic is full of stellar individuals. I've never waited longer than five minutes past a scheduled appointment time. The folks at the front desk work non-stop and learn your name. I also see some professionals for mental health care. Similar story as above.

I had a cat-bite that got infected. They worked me in with my primary care physician, she prescribed an antibiotic, and the front desk provided a voucher so I could fill it at the pharmacy down the street. I did have to wait about 3.5 hrs to be seen, but they were doing their best to see all scheduled appts and several walk-ins.

As a veteran, this care was zero cost to me. What a relief it has been to be able to get my health under control and to know there are professionals available when I need them.

name: Johanna Lodder
text:
I was in a car accident, ended up with neck fusion herniated disc, lots of pain.  Considering I never used a primary care doctor before this because I didn't need one, went to gynecologist yearly, that was it. Suddenly it was lots of doctors tests etc.  Spent the last two years with orthopedic, chiropractors, muscular therapists but still in pain, still not able to sleep well.   Pain changes you....but I wasn't going to give up yet. My primary care Dr. recommended Lions Mane and Dr Z. Ordered the supplement on Amazon started taking it, it really helped with brain fog from concussion. So I headed off to Dr Z, not expecting too much, I was already seeing a chropracter.  Wow, what a difference, decompression has reduced the nagging pain, the first morning after, I woke up because I was rested!  Hadn't done that since...before accident.  I get up now in the morning and can feel my feet, and walk normally, not like I have flippers.  I had ligaments and muscles whining and complaining, because now my hips were staying where they should and everything had to stretch.  But I did my stretches and my ankles and left leg aren't hurting like they did.
I am actually thinking about exercising again,  this experience has made me hopefull again.  Thank you.

resp.text: Thank you for the wonderful review and I am so happy that you are doing so much better!

name: Donielle McLendon
text:
I injured myself almost 4 years ago. My left foot and sciatic nerve have caused me to be in almost constant pain since. Before the injury, I ran about 30-45 miles per week, but I have not been able to workout with any regularity since, and it was depressing. I have seen 2 orthopedic surgeons, another chiropractor, a podiatrist, an acupuncturist (a different practice), and massage therapists with little relief. It’s not that they were bad, but they weren’t looking in the right place. He really listened to me and I appreciate that.
Dr. Zlotea has been treating me for the past few weeks for a herniated disc and other issues. He recommended using decompression therapy and it has worked wonders! I don’t think I would have been able to workout again if not for him. I’m only 32 and finally don’t feel like I’m 102. I am able to start light exercise again as of today and I couldn’t be happier! My foot doesn’t hurt at all anymore! I feel like I’m getting my life back.

name: Kendall Jackson
text:
As some of you may remember, in November 2011 I was involved in a vehicular hit and run on Ross Clark Circle, in which I was a pedestrian. To give you an idea of the impact, it fragmented my tibia and fibula in half (lower leg bones). I incurred a lot of bodily damage. At one point I could barely walk due to the various pains due to misalignment. The photo attached shows how much of my skin was removed by the ground, although and I was wearing a pea coat at the time of the incident. To keep things short, I'm less afraid of vehicles passing me on my morning runs than I am to try a new chiropractor. I love the down-to-Earth atmosphere at his office. I strongly recommend you at least give it a few visits to see if his structure is right for you. It only took me ONCE.

Thank you Dr. Z

Kendall Jackson

name: Charlie Crowe
text: I was a little disappointed with my visit. Before I had done the in take paper work as a new patient we were talking about  12 visit plan. I didn’t feel that I was heard. There seemed to be an agenda other than my condition. I will say that they had me in and out fast.

resp.text:
Thank you for your review. Your input is appreciated.
Your perspective on the first visit is different than most of our patients but significant. The intake paperwork asks the patient to list all their symptoms and quantify their health complaints and instructs the patients to quantify their level of improvement over the next 12 treatments.... That is correct. The reason the paperwork addresses a treatment plan is so patients are aware from the beginning that holistic treatment is not a one treatment panacea, it's not a pill and it's not magic. It is a healing process and the specifics are handled individually with each patient.
A 20 minutes face to face with a physician is unheard of these days and if you feel that was a short visit so be it. In a 20-minute visit we addressed the entire human frame above and beyond the chief complaint plus acupuncture and tongue analysis. The process didn't stop when you left the office but it continued as the tongue analysis was performed by OUM physicians in California and THERE WERE THREE EMAIL CONVERSATIONS REGARDING THE SPECIFICS. That was a step I take out of true concern for the health and well-being of my patients but it's cases like these that make excellent physicians become callus.
Best of luck on your journey and next time find something to praise about the next person that gives a damn about your health and well-being

text: Poor if I could give a zero I would. I went into their office for the first time.  I was told that I was not a good fit for there care at their office by the receptionist at the desk. Apparently they don’t treat people with mental illness.

name: Jessica Saxon
text: This review goes to Nathan at Southern Psychiatry. I've never been to therapy before in my life and was utterly nervous about going my first time. Nathan was not only reassuring but he was compassionate, understanding, and attentive to my needs and helped me in ways I honestly never thought possible. Hes extremely cool and just overall easy to talk to and he feels like your best friend. He works out plans that are best for you and YOUR needs. There is laughing and so much healing within this one hour its unbelievable. I'm so happy I found the best therapist EVER. Please go see Nathan guys. Hes so awesome!

name: Shannon Lundgren
text: I have seen several providers at Southern Psychiatry for about 18 months.  In that time, the initial concerns which drove me to seek help from them were not addressed, nor did any of the staff adequately explain to me why they gave me the diagnosises they did.  I also had to remind the healthcare providers why I was there on followup visits.  Their front office - when you can get them to answer the phone - are in capable of telling you when your appointment is or which of your medical records you are legally entitled to.  Try literally any other place first.

name: Ki Freeman
text: The ONLY reason I give them 3 stars is because of Dr. Sadler.  It took weeks for me to get an appointment, well I guess I should say a call back for an appointment.   Dr. Sadler was extremely thorough and answered all my questions during my video call.  It took them MONTHS to bill me after my insurance company processed the claim.  The website did not seem very secure to make payment so I attempted to call and make payment over the phone.  Almost 2 weeks later and 2 voice mails and I finally gave up and mailed my payment.  No call back to this day.  I hope my payment that I sent over a week ago is applied to my balance and that I am not put in collections.  Very disappointing and tough on my mental health.....

name: Meep Meeperson
text: Dr. Sadler and Mr. Nathan are wonderful

name: Kimberly Rossler
text: I really want to like this practice bc I see the PA Valerie who is beyond amazing! But not once has Dr.Sadler been involved with my treatment. Valerie is amazing but not a psychiatrist so it’s hard for me to believe I am getting the help that’s needed bc a actual DR should be the one diagnosing me . The office is pure horrible! Don’t even try calling ! I only will email instead of calling so I have a record to prove communication with the office staff. If you leave a voicemail you’ll be called back days later. I am trying to get help with my mental illness but it’s really hard at this place when the office staff will test your patience . It’s not a professional place at all and it’s sad!

name: Joe Pitts
text: Dr. Sadler is amazing, Miranda is phenomenal, I love when we chat, and Nicole is phenomenal! Thank You guys so much!

name: Emily Horn
text: The most thorough and friendly staff Ive ever been to. Ive been seeing mental health professionals for over 10 years and have never been as impressed as I am with this place.

Valerie is FANTASTIC. My previous Dr closed her practice, what a blessing in disguise that ended up being! Valerie is so personable.
My experience at SP has been top notch. I highly recommend them.

Threadgill, I can truly just be me,  she listens very attentively, makes sure that you understand any and all instructions that are given and will make sure that you are getting the most out of your visits. If I must say she is a phenomenal woman, excellent in her craft.

name: Courtney Lang
text: I give Dr Threadgill along with the office staff 5 stars for their kindness and their ability to make my experiences extremely pleasant. I’ve never had an issue with scheduling my appointments, in fact I’ve found that her flexibility regarding accommodating my busy schedule to be unmatched to any other provider. I feel completely confident and comfortable in her skills and her ability to address any and all of my concerns.

name: Dana C
text: I feel comfortable with Dr. Cristal. I have seen her a couple of times. She is professional and explains my medicines and reason for lab test. I did have a problem with a medicine at the drugstore but she got my message and worked it out. I like that she offers late evening appointments. She saw me on my lunch one time. Thank u

name: Charlotte Plunkett
text: The doctors and staff at Southern Psychiatry are amazing.  They are kind, caring and want to help figure out the best treatment for you.  I had the best experience.  Thank You Southern Psychiatry.  Also love the therapy dog.

name: LeAnn Miller
text: Very unprofessional. Doctor Crystal was extremely forgetful, phone staff was rude and almost never returned my calls. Doctor Crystal made excuses for rude staff, they're hard to get ahold of because they won't answer the phone, had issues trying to refill prescriptions. They couldn't find my consent form to release medical records so they said they'd fax a new form for me to sign and they never did. Waited 45 minutes for an appointment with Dr. Bennett before they told me someone should have told me I was supposed to be in a different waiting room. Had testing set up with Dr. Bennet's office and they cancelled the day before. Found out they lied about why it was cancelled. Told me they accepted Medicaid and had no copay but after two appointments they called and told me I needed a referral from my primary care Doctor in order for Medicaid to pay which they NEVER mentioned before and said I owe over $200. Felt like doctor Crystal didn't listen and overall felt like they didn't care whatsoever. This place added to my anxiety and was probably the worst mental health clinic I've been to.

name: Jamie
text: The staff are nice enough and the lady I saw was polite, reasonable, and down-to-earth.  However, two huge issues. 1.) she seemed to be working on an almost assembly line sort of protocol and took a very short time to listen to my concerns and prescribed medications that gave me multiple concerns due to potential side effects I wanted to avoid 2.) the lady with whom they scheduled my appointment also did not have her insurance credentials in order so I ended up paying 155.00 out of pocket. I have excellent insurance and I would have had zero copay if she could’ve accepted my insurance. I paid because they assured me that by the time my follow up appointment was scheduled they would have the situation remedied. I called before I went to the next appointment and was advised she still didn’t have credentials for united healthcare so the visit would cost 90.0. I canceled the appointment and will have to find another doctor. This has also left me dealing with the side effects of those medications without any support in handling that. All around, I do not advise going here. The building is not handicap accessible which makes it more difficult for me as I don’t do that well with stairs sometimes, they don’t seem to have their business in order, they don’t seem to take the time to truly understand your issue and act appropriately, and I was left with a strong impression that they simply didn’t care much. If anything they should have said come into your appointment and we will not charge you and will handle the insurance after the fact. I do not understand why they think it is acceptable to force a patient to pay their outrageous prices for twenty minutes of their time when it’s their fault they’re not getting paid through insurance. Perhaps they have resolved the issue, perhaps not, but definitely call and question absolutely everything they tell you because they seemed to have no problem surprising me not only once with a bill I shoudn’t have had to pay, but they didn’t even call me before the follow up to advise me I would again be required to pay out of pocket.

name: J Watkins
text: Most horrible experience I have ever had. The Psychiatrist is unprofessional. The office is the dirtiest office I’ve ever encountered in a Health Care setting. He brings a dog to work with him that uses the restroom on the floor. The receptionist that obtains urine for drug screens just leaves the urine laying around in open areas. The management team is unprofessional as well. Unethical behavior on charging patients for no show visits even after the patients call to reschedule appointments.  Worst service ever.

name: Bart Roberts
text: First time there and it was a great experience. Hats off to Dr Sadler

text: Friendly staff. Good Dr. And counselor.

name: Bobbie Craft
text: Friendly staff. Good Dr. And counselor.

name: Kimberly
text: I do NOT recommend this doctor’s office.  I agree with every negative review posted about them: The office is unappealing, but that can be overlooked.  People have complained about the receptionists, but they were nice to me.  People were charged no-show fees and co-pays when while on their insurance they have never owed a co-pay: the latter happened to me.  Someone said they treat you like a drug addict and I can see that as well.  You are drug screened before you see a doctor on your first visit.  Oh, and you have to use a public restroom in the main hallway of the building and carry your urine sample to them in plain view for anyone to see.  Other complaints have been about the apathy of the doctors, and I can relate to that as well.  I requested a refill for my medication 10 days before I was to run out and the doctor said she wrote me enough pills to get me to my next appointment plus 1 refill when in actuality my prescription bottle and the copy of the electronic prescription I got directly from the pharmacy shows otherwise, and in fact a lot less.

name: John Sullivan
text: My Wife preparing for a surgery in a few months and one of the requirements of her surgery is a Psych Eval.  Appointment was made with this physicians office.  Upon arriving, she's told that she has not met her deductible and that the visit would be $152.00, which doesn't make sense as she has already had surgery this year and multiple test done.  She had her debit card but had paid bills the day prior (of course) and only had $94.00.  The physician said he would see her for $100.00 but she only had $94.00 so she was not seen.   Now even though she was thoroughly embarrassed over the entire situation, she had rescheduled for another day.    Two weeks later, we get a bill in the mail charging a $100.00 NO SHOW fee.  Now I understand that they want their money in advance but ...she wasn't a NO SHOW.  The physician's office refused to see her.  I'm sorry this seems very tacky.  Now they've lost out on both ends as they lost a potential patient and she's refused to pay their NO SHOW fee.   Maybe it should be a Not Seen Fee...........

name: Amber Turrentine
text:
While I have never attended a session, I did reach out to schedule an appointment. I left a message and received a call back the next day. The receptionist said that there wouldn't be any new patient appointments until mid March. This is pretty common for first visits. My concern came when she asked for my credit or debit card number. When I asked why she seemed somewhat offended. The reason given was in case a don't show for an appointment. I have been to three different practices and not once have I been asked to give out my debit card number over the phone. I said that I didn't feel comfortable doing that and thanked her for her time.

If you dont feel comfortable giving out your debit or credit card number over the phone, I wouldn't suggest this place.

name: Alexandra Stegall
text:
I am a retired veteran that was admitted to this hospital twice during my Service as an active duty soldier at Fort Rucker, AL. I was experiencing PTSD and extreme distress during my service and was admitted to this hospital’s behavioral health unit twice within a year. Here’s my story:

The first time I was admitted, it was voluntary...
I was going through a lot on base, where I lived. My chain of command in the military allowed me to admit myself for a short period of time. They wanted me to get myself together and have me go back to continuing my service.

The neglect for patients here was disgusting to say the least. The staff allowed my chain of command to enter the unit without my password. They were the last people I wanted to see. I was sure that this was illegal and requested to speak to a supervisor, who told me it was my mistake for not turning them away. Being a soldier, I knew she did not understand that I could not do that and she clearly did not care about the law that her staff was breaking. This was not the only kind of neglect I witnessed/experienced. The geriatrics room was so sad. The older patients are sat down in chairs all day and night, in front of a tv. One of the older men was taken into a private room with a female tech. When they came out, he had a bloody mark on his forehead. Some of us patients noticed but felt that nobody would do anything about it. Another older gentleman in the geriatrics room died while I was there. Nobody knew the cause but he was wrapped up in a sheet and placed into a giant gray bin and wheeled away in front of all of the other patients!

During this first stay at this hospital, there was a day where a group of student nurses were visiting to observe the staff and patients. They were observing a therapy group where the therapist was breaking HIPAA laws and verbally exposing each patient’s diagnosis in front of all of the other patients, as well as the student nurses.

The second time I was admitted, I was court ordered. My command knew I was in distress and did not know what to do with me. I was sent to this hospital a second time and knew that it would not be a long stay. I was met by two giant men, telling me I have been court ordered to the psychiatric unit. I knew that something wasn’t right and that the court order was not justified. This time, they admitted me to the third-floor. There were beds available on the second floor but had decided that I would be better off on the third floor. Anyone who has been to this unit, knows that the third floor is for patients with severe mental health issues... this time, there was a poster on the wall with all of the patient rights (that wasn’t there before)... I read all of my rates and noticed that it said that I could request a patient advocate and a lawyer. When I approached the glass window at the desk, I requested Mary Anne, A wonderful recreational therapist that I remembered from my first stay- as well as a lawyer!... I was met with a nasty attitude and told to sit down because I was court ordered. At this point, I was panicking and angry so I threw a fit in order to get the attention of whoever was above this woman telling me to take a seat. When I got the supervisors attention, I requested that lawyer and therapist. The lawyer asked me if I had been “Baker Acted” but I had no idea what that meant. He pulled up my information on a computer and informed me that I had not been “baker acted” and could leave anytime I wanted. I was out of there within a few hours!

What a horrifying experience this was. The neglect and abuse here is disgusting and I would never EVER recommend anyone admit themselves to this hospital!

name: Meghan Clements
text: My Psychiatry Clinic is THE BEST! With other mental health offices we have used, we either found a doctor that doesn't seem to really care, rude receptionists, and/or it's almost impossible to get an emergency appointment. You won't find any of that at My Psychiatry! They are nothing but friendly, caring, and compassionate. I will never be able to express my gratitude for what Dr. Islam has done for my family, and to Roman for always working with us and getting us in for an appointment. Absolutely recommended!!

name: Matthew 123456
text:
I moved Back home to Birmingham after struggling for years in Florida with my issues compounded by a lack of available Doctors in Pensacola that could treat me without Insurance currently and with the new Covid guidelines it was nearly impossible to get the help needed there.

By Chance I called Dr. Islam from googling for psychiatrists here and was stunned that he actually answered the phone, then set up an appointment for initial visit the next Day!

I didn't know what to expect and just took a shot at this new video conference method and it went flawless.

On top of the great service, Dr. Islam's true talent showed in the visit and outcome so far.

Somehow he deciphered me trying to explain almost 25 years of taking medication for Depression at first, then anxiety in college,  and a variety of issues ever since.

I knew the best method was not to sugar coat the severity of how bad I have been feeling and that I was basically unable to function normally, except for bare minumum to survive.
I just told him the truth that I was basically staying home and not able to see a way out but that I never gave up hope but that I was in serious need of help.

I told him what I thought I needed based on what had helped in the past; but also that I trust him over my opinion bc obviously my past regiment had not really helped me bc I had stagnated overall even when had all the help I thought I needed over the last 5 years..

Amazingly he was able to understand my root problem better than I did honesly and prescribed a medication that has litterally changed my Life.

For the 1st time in 8 years or so, I feel free from the over whelming anxiety and sadness and fear that had ruled me for a decade and he did it with a novel approach that I didnt even know existed and had never heard of as a medication for my underlying issue of anxiety/depression/and an inablity to take needed action.

How I had never been diagnosed this way or offered this class of medication is just an example of the stigma and problems still around mental health..  Perhaps my previous doctors were influenced by the labels and words used to describe some of my symptoms which caused them to think I didnt need this form of treatment.. I dont know but there are medicines that will help you that you may never have heard of like me.

It actually makes my brain WORK the right way Versus just numbing it, and covering over the problem .

I am now in a position that I am safely tapering off the medication that I dont truly need to be on(faster than I thought I could) and put that "mistake" in the past and I am focused on my life and my future for the first time in years.

Never give up hope! Dont settle for bad help or mediocre treatment that just helps you "get by" each day as long as you have your "meds"

If you not thriving or on a path too it dont settle like I did for way too long.

Dont assume you know the only things that will work for you and be TOTALLY honest with the Dr so he can help you .

Im even getting back into old hobbies and my next new career goals and even back into My Faith in God.

If you or someone you know is struggling please take this as a message of hope that its never too late and never hopeless.

God Bless and Thank you to Dr. Islam and Thanks to President Trump or whoever in the Government made this Tele-Medicine / new video conferencing option available. Without it I may never have found Dr. Islam.

Thank You Dr. Islam

Sincerely,

Matt
